ProcedureOptionHelp.#cdata:
Requests all of the tables generated by the FREQ, MODES, NEXTRVAL=5, CIBASIC, CIPCTLDF, and 
CIPCTLNORMAL options.

[Syntax: ALPHA=value] 
      
Specifies the default confidence level for all confidence limits computed by the CAPABILITY procedure. 
The coverage percent for the confidence limits is (1-value)100. For example, ALPHA=0.10 results in
90% confidence limits. The default value is 0.05.

[Syntax: ANNOTATE=SAS-data-set] 
      
Specifies an input data set containing annotate variables as described in SAS/GRAPH documentation.

Syntax: CHECKINDICES<(<TEST = SW | KS | AD | CVM | NONE> <ALPHA=value>)>
      
Specifies the test of normality used in conjunction with process capability indices that are displayed 
in the Process Capability Indices table.

Syntax: CIBASIC<(<TYPE=LOWER | UPPER | TWOSIDED><ALPHA=value>)>
      
Requests confidence limits for the mean, standard deviation, and variance based on the assumption 
that the data are normally distributed. 

  TYPE=keyword 
  specifies the type of confidence limit, where keyword is LOWER, UPPER, or TWOSIDED. The default 
  value is TWOSIDED. 

  ALPHA=value 
  specifies the confidence level.

Syntax: CIPCTLDF<(<TYPE=LOWER | UPPER | TWOSIDED><ALPHA=value>)>
      
Requests confidence limits for quantiles computed using a distribution-free method.  

  TYPE=keyword 
  specifies the type of confidence limit, where keyword is LOWER, UPPER, SYMMETRIC, or ASYMMETRIC. 
  The default value is SYMMETRIC.  

  ALPHA=value 
  specifies the confidence level.

Syntax: CIPCTLNORMAL<(<TYPE=LOWER | UPPER | TWOSIDED><ALPHA=value>)>
      
requests confidence limits for quantiles based on the assumption that the data are normally distributed.  

TYPE=keyword 
specifies the type of confidence limit.  

ALPHA=value 
specifies the confidence level.

Syntax: CIPROBEX<(<TYPE=LOWER | UPPER | TWOSIDED><ALPHA=value>)>
      
Requests confidence limits for Pr[X <= LSL] and Pr[X  ≥  USL], where X is the analysis variable, 
LSL is the lower specification limit, and USL is the upper specification limit.

  TYPE=keyword 
  specifies the type of confidence limit, where keyword is LOWER, UPPER, or TWOSIDED. The default 
  value is TWOSIDED. 

  ALPHA=value 
  specifies the confidence level.

[Syntax: CPMA=value] 
      
Specifies the value of the parameter α for the capability index Cpm(a). This option has been superseded 
by the SPECIALINDICES(CPMA=) option.

[Syntax: DATA=SAS-data-set] 
      
Specifies the input data set containing the observations to be analyzed.

[Syntax: DEF=index] 
      
Is an alias for the PCTLDEF= option.
Excludes observations with non-positive weight values (zero or nonnegative) for the analysis.

[Syntax: FORMCHAR(index)='string'] 
      
Defines characters used for features on plots, where index is a number ranging from 1 to 11, 
and string is a character or hexadecimal string. The index identifies which features are controlled
with the string characters. The features associated with values of index are as follows:
        
Index  Description of Character         Chart Feature  
1       vertical bar                    frame, ecdf line, HREF= lines 
2       horizontal bar                  frame, ecdf line, VREF= lines 
3       box character (upper left)      frame, ecdf line, histogram bars 
4       box character (upper middle)    histogram bars, tick marks (horizontal axis) 
5       box character (upper right)     frame, histogram bars 
6       box character (middle left)     histogram bars 
7       box character (middle middle)   not used 
8       box character (middle right)    histogram bars, tick marks (vertical axis) 
9       box character (lower left)      frame 
10      box character (lower middle)    histogram bars 
11      box character (lower right)     frame, ecdf line

Requests a frequency table in the printed output that contains the variable values, frequencies, 
percentages, and cumulative percentages.

[Syntax: GOUT=graphics-catalog] 
      
Specifies a graphics catalog in which to save graphics output.
Requests that line printer plots be produced. By default, the procedure creates traditional graphics.
Requests a table with the number of observations greater than, not equal to, and less than the value of MUO=.

Requests a table of all possible modes. By default, when the data contains multiple modes, PROC CAPABILITY
displays the lowest mode in the table of basic statistical measures. When all values are unique, 
PROC CAPABILITY does not produce a table of modes.

[Syntax: MU0=value(s)] 
      
Specifies the value of the mean or location parameter (uo) in the null hypothesis for the tests 
summarized in the table labeled Tests for Location: Mu0=value.

[Syntax: NEXTROBS=n] 
      
Specifies the number of extreme observations in the table labeled Extreme Observations. 
The table lists the n lowest observations and the n highest observations. The default 
value is 5.

[Syntax: NEXTRVAL=n] 
      
Requests the table labeled Extreme Values and specifies the number of extreme values in 
the table. The table lists the n lowest unique values and the n highest unique values. The 
value of n must be an integer between 0 and half the maximum number of observations.

Suppresses the tables of descriptive statistics and capability indices which are created 
by the PROC CAPABILITY statement.
Requests a table of Tests for Normality for each of the analysis variables.

[Syntax: OUTTABLE=SAS-data-set] 
      
Specifies an output data set that contains univariate statistics and capability indices arranged 
in tabular form.
Specifies one of five definitions used to calculate percentiles.

Requests a table of robust measures of scale. These measures include the interquartile 
range, Gini's mean difference, the median absolute deviation about the median (MAD), 
and two statistics proposed by Rousseeuw and Croux (1993), Qn, and Sn.

[Syntax: ROUND=value-list] 
      
Specifies units used to round variable values.

Requests a table of specialized process capability indices. You can specify the following 
options in parentheses after the SPECIALINDICES option:

  CPMA=value 
  specifies the value of the parameter, a,  for the capability index Cpm(a)

  CPU=value 
  specifies the value of the parameter, u, for Vännmann's capability index Cp(u,v).

  CPV=value 
  specifies the value of the parameter v for Vännmann's capability indices Cp(u,v) and Cp(v).

  CSGAMMA=value 
  specifies the value of the γ multiplier suggested by Chen and Kotz (1996) for Wright's capability index, Cs

[Syntax: SPECS=SAS-data-set] 
      
Specifies an input data set containing specification limits for each of the variables in the VAR statement.

Syntax: TRIMMED=values(s) <(TYPE=keyword><ALPHA=value>)>
      
Requests a table of trimmed means, where each value specifies the number or the proportion of 
trimmed observations.

  TYPE=keyword 
  specifies the type of confidence limit, where keyword is LOWER, UPPER, or TWOSIDED. The default 
  value is TWOSIDED. 

  ALPHA=value 
  specifies the confidence level.
Specifies the divisor to use in the calculation of variances and standard deviations.

Syntax: WINSORIZED=values(s) <(TYPE=keyword><ALPHA=value>)>
      
Requests a table of winsorized means, where each value specifies the number or the proportion of 
winsorized observations. 

  TYPE=keyword 
  specifies the type of confidence limit, where keyword is LOWER, UPPER, or TWOSIDED. The default 
  value is TWOSIDED. 

  ALPHA=value 
  specifies the confidence level.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: CLASS variable-1 <(v-options)> <variable-2 <(v-options)>> 
  </ KEYLEVEL= value1 | (value1 value2)> ; 
  
The CLASS statement specifies one or two variables used to group the data into 
classification levels. Variables in a CLASS statement are referred to as CLASS 
variables. CLASS variables can be numeric or character. Class variables can have 
floating point values, but they typically have a few discrete values that define 
levels of the variable. You do not have to sort the data by CLASS variables. 
PROC CAPABILITY uses the formatted values of the CLASS variables to determine 
the classification levels. 

Note:You cannot specify a COMPHISTOGRAM statement together with a CLASS statement.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: KEYLEVEL=value | ( value1 value2 ) 

Specifies the key cells in comparative plots. For each plot, PROC CAPABILITY first 
determines the horizontal axis scaling for the key cell, and then extends the axis 
using the established tick interval to accommodate the data ranges for the remaining 
cells, if necessary. Thus, the choice of the key cell determines the uniform horizontal 
axis that PROC CAPABILITY uses for all cells.

Specifies that the location of the key cell in a comparative plot be unchanged by 
the CLASS statement KEYLEVEL= option. By default, the key cell is positioned as 
the first cell in a comparative plot. 

The NOKEYMOVE option has no effect unless you specify a plot statement.

[Syntax: CLEFT=color] 
          
Determines the color used to fill the area under a histogram to the left of the lower 
specification limit.

[Syntax: CLSL=color] 
          
Specifies the color of the lower specification line displayed in plots created with the CDFPLOT, 
COMPHISTOGRAM, HISTOGRAM, PROBPLOT, and QQPLOT statements.

[Syntax: CRIGHT=color] 
          
Determines the color used to fill the area under a histogram to the right of the upper 
specification limit.

[Syntax: CTARGET=color] 
          
Specifies the color of the target line displayed in plots created with the CDFPLOT, COMPHISTOGRAM, 
HISTOGRAM, PROBPLOT, and QQPLOT statements.

[Syntax: CUSL=color] 
          
Specifies the color of the upper specification line displayed in plots created with the CDFPLOT, 
COMPHISTOGRAM, HISTOGRAM, PROBPLOT, and QQPLOT statements.

[Syntax: LLSL=linetype] 
          
Specifies the line type for the lower specification line displayed in plots created with the CDFPLOT, 
COMPHISTOGRAM, HISTOGRAM, PROBPLOT, and QQPLOT statements.

[Syntax: LSL=value-list] 
          
Specifies the lower specification limits for the variables listed in the VAR statement, or for all 
numeric variables in the input data set if no VAR statement is used.

[Syntax: LSLSYMBOL='character'] 
          
Specifies the character used to display the lower specification line in line printer plots created 
with the CDFPLOT, HISTOGRAM, PROBPLOT, and QQPLOT statements. The default character is 'L'.

[Syntax: LTARGET=linetype] 
          
Specifies the line type for the target line in plots created with the CDFPLOT, COMPHISTOGRAM, 
HISTOGRAM, PROBPLOT, and QQPLOT statements.

[Syntax: LUSL=linetype] 
          
Specifies the line type for the upper specification line displayed in plots created with the CDFPLOT, 
COMPHISTOGRAM, HISTOGRAM, PROBPLOT, and QQPLOT statements.

[Syntax: PLEFT=pattern] 
          
Specifies the pattern used to fill the area under a histogram to the left of the lower 
specification limit.

[Syntax: PRIGHT=pattern] 
          
Specifies the pattern used to fill the area under a histogram to the right of the upper 
specification limit.

[Syntax: TARGET=value-list] 
          
Specifies a target values for the variables listed in the VAR statement, or for all numeric 
variables in the input data set if no VAR statement is used.

[Syntax: TARGETSYMBOL='character'] 
          
Specifies the character used to display the target line in line printer plots created with the 
CDFPLOT, HISTOGRAM, PROBPLOT, and QQPLOT statements. The default character is 'T'.

[Syntax: USL=value-list] 
          
Specifies the upper specification limits for the variables listed in the VAR statement, or for all 
numeric variables in the input data set if no VAR statement is used.

[Syntax: USLSYMBOL='character'] 
          
Specifies the character used to display the upper specification line in line printer plots created 
with the CDFPLOT, HISTOGRAM, PROBPLOT, and QQPLOT statements. The default character is 'U'.

[Syntax: WLSL=n] 
          
Specifies the width in pixels of the lower specification line in plots created with the CDFPLOT, 
COMPHISTOGRAM, HISTOGRAM, PROBPLOT, and QQPLOT statements.

[Syntax: WTARGET=n] 
          
Specifies the width in pixels of the target line in plots created with the CDFPLOT, COMPHISTOGRAM, 
HISTOGRAM, PROBPLOT, and QQPLOT statements.

[Syntax: WUSL=n] 
          
Specifies the width in pixels of the upper specification line in plots created with the CDFPLOT, 
COMPHISTOGRAM, HISTOGRAM, PROBPLOT, and QQPLOT statements.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: CDFPLOT <variables> < / options> ;
      
Plots the observed cumulative distribution function (cdf) of a variable.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: ALPHA=value] 
          
Specifies the shape parameter α (α > 0) for distribution functions requested with the BETA and 
GAMMA options.

[Syntax: BETA<(beta-options)>] 
          
Displays a fitted beta distribution function on the cdf plot.
          
Description of beta-options:  

ALPHA=value -- specifies first shape parameter, α, for beta distribution function 
BETA=value -- specifies second shape parameter, β, for beta distribution function 
SIGMA=value -- specifies scale parameter, σ, for beta distribution function 
THETA=value -- specifies lower threshold parameter, θ, for beta distribution function 
COLOR=color -- specifies color of theoretical distribution function 
L=linetype -- specifies line type of theoretical distribution function 
SYMBOL='character' -- specifies character used to plot theoretical distribution function on line printer plots 
W=n -- specifies width of theoretical distribution function

[Syntax: BETA=value] 
          
Specifies the second shape parameter, β, for beta distribution functions requested by the BETA option.

[Syntax: C=value] 
          
Specifies the shape parameter, c, for Weibull distribution functions requested with the WEIBULL option.

[Syntax: CDFSYMBOL='character'] 
          
Specifies the character used to plot the points on cdf line printer plots. The default is the plus sign (+).

[Syntax: EXPONENTIAL<( exponential-options )>] 
          
Displays a fitted exponential distribution function on the cdf plot.
          
Description of exponential-options:  

SIGMA=value -- specifies scale parameter, σ, for exponential distribution function 
THETA=value -- specifies threshold parameter, θ, for exponential distribution function 
COLOR=color -- specifies color of theoretical distribution function 
L=linetype -- specifies line type of theoretical distribution function 
SYMBOL='character' -- specifies character used to plot theoretical distribution function on line printer plots 
W= -- specifies width of theoretical distribution function

[Syntax: GAMMA<(gamma-options)>] 
          
Displays a fitted gamma distribution function on the cdf plot.
          
Description of gamma-options:  
ALPHADELTA=value -- specifies change in successive estimates of α at which the Newton-Raphson approximation of -hat terminates 
ALPHAINITIAL=value -- specifies initial value for α in the Newton-Raphson approximation of α-hat 
MAXITER= -- specifies maximum number of iterations in the Newton-Raphson approximation of α-hat 
SIGMA=value -- specifies scale parameter, σ, for gamma distribution function 
ALPHA=value -- specifies shape parameter, α,  for gamma distribution function 
THETA=value -- specifies threshold parameter, θ, for gamma distribution function
COLOR=color -- specifies color of theoretical distribution function 
L=linetype -- specifies line type of theoretical distribution function 
SYMBOL='character' -- specifies character used to plot theoretical distribution function on line printer plots 
W= -- specifies width of theoretical distribution function

[Syntax: LEGEND=name | NONE] 
          
Specifies the name of a LEGEND statement describing the legend for specification limit 
reference lines and superimposed distribution functions. 

LEGEND=NONE suppresses all legend information, and is equivalent to specifying the 
NOLEGEND option.
Suppresses all legend information, and is equivalent to specifying the NOLEGEND option.

[Syntax: LOGNORMAL<(lognormal-options)>] 
          
Displays a fitted lognormal distribution function on the cdf plot.
          
Description of lognormal-options: 

ZETA=value -- specifies scale parameter, ζ, for lognormal distribution function 
SIGMA=value -- specifies shape parameter, σ,  for lognormal distribution function 
THETA=value -- specifies threshold parameter, θ, for lognormal distribution function
COLOR=color -- specifies color of theoretical distribution function 
L=linetype -- specifies line type of theoretical distribution function 
SYMBOL='character' -- specifies character used to plot theoretical distribution function on line printer plots 
W= -- specifies width of theoretical distribution function

[Syntax: MU=value] 
          
Specifies the parameter, µ,  for normal distribution functions requested with the NORMAL option.
Suppresses the legend for the superimposed theoretical cumulative distribution function.

Suppresses the observed distribution function (the empirical cumulative distribution function) of 
the variable, which is drawn by default.
Suppresses legends for specification limits, theoretical distribution functions, and hidden observations.

[Syntax: NORMAL<(normal-options)>] 
          
Displays a fitted normal distribution function on the cdf plot.
          
Description of normal-options:  

MU=value -- specifies mean µ for normal distribution function 
SIGMA=value -- specifies standard deviation, σ, for normal distribution function
COLOR=color -- specifies color of theoretical distribution function 
L=linetype -- specifies line type of theoretical distribution function 
SYMBOL='character' -- specifies character used to plot theoretical distribution function on line printer plots 
W= -- specifies width of theoretical distribution function
Suppresses the portion of the legend for specification limit reference lines.

[Syntax: SIGMA=value | EST] 
          
Specifies the parameter, σ, for distribution functions requested by the BETA, EXPONENTIAL, GAMMA, 
LOGNORMAL, NORMAL, and WEIBULL options.

[Syntax: SYMBOL='character'] 
          
Specifies the character used to plot the theoretical distribution function on line printer plots. 
Enclose the SYMBOL= option in parentheses after the distribution option.

[Syntax: THETA=value | EST] 
          
Specifies the lower threshold parameter, θ,  for theoretical cumulative distribution functions 
requested with the BETA, EXPONENTIAL, GAMMA, LOGNORMAL, and WEIBULL options.

[Syntax: THRESHOLD=value | EST] 
          
Specifies the lower threshold parameter, θ,  for theoretical cumulative distribution functions 
requested with the BETA, EXPONENTIAL, GAMMA, LOGNORMAL, and WEIBULL options.
Specifies the scale of the vertical axis.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Scales the data in units of the number of observations per data unit.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Scales the data in units of percent of observations per data unit. This is the default.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Scales the data in units of proportion of observations per data unit.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: WEIBULL<(Weibull-options)>] 
          
Displays a fitted Weibull distribution function on the cdf plot.
          
Description of Weibull-options: 

C=value -- specifies shape parameter c for Weibull distribution function 
CDELTA=value -- specifies change in successive estimates of c at which the Newton-Raphson approximation of c-hat terminates 
CINITIAL=value -- specifies initial value for c in the Newton-Raphson approximation of  
MAXITER=value -- specifies maximum number of iterations in the Newton-Raphson approximation of c-hat 
SIGMA=value -- specifies scale parameter, σ, for Weibull distribution function 
THETA=value -- specifies threshold parameter, θ, for Weibull distribution function 
COLOR=color -- specifies color of theoretical distribution function 
L=linetype -- specifies line type of theoretical distribution function 
SYMBOL='character' -- specifies character used to plot theoretical distribution function on line printer plots 
W= -- specifies width of theoretical distribution function

[Syntax: ZETA=value] 
          
Specifies a value for the scale parameter, ζ, for a lognormal distribution function requested with 
the LOGNORMAL option.

[Syntax: ALPHADELTA=value] 
          
Specifies the change in successive estimates of α-hat at which iteration terminates in the 
Newton-Raphson approximation of the maximum likelihood estimate of α for gamma distributions 
requested with the GAMMA option.

[Syntax: ALPHAINITIAL=value] 
          
Specifies the initial value for α-hat in the Newton-Raphson approximation of the maximum likelihood 
estimate of α for gamma distributions requested with the GAMMA option. Enclose the ALPHAINITIAL= option 
in parentheses after the GAMMA keyword.
Applies the annotation requested with the ANNOTATE= option only to the key cell of a comparative plot.

[Syntax: ANNOTATE=SAS-data-set] 
          
Specifies an input data set that contains annotate variables.

[Syntax: CAXIS=color] 
          
Specifies the color for the axes and tick marks.

[Syntax: CDELTA=value] 
          
Specifies the change in successive estimates of c at which iterations terminate in 
the Newton-Raphson approximation of the maximum likelihood estimate of c for Weibull 
distributions requested by the WEIBULL option. Enclose the CDELTA= option in parentheses 
after the WEIBULL keyword. Iteration continues until the change in c between consecutive 
steps is less than the value specified or until the number of iterations exceeds the value 
of the MAXITER= option. The default value is 0.00001.

[Syntax: CFRAME=color] 
          
Specifies the color for the area that is enclosed by the axes and frame. The area 
is not filled by default.

[Syntax: CFRAMESIDE=color] 
          
Specifies the color to fill the frame area for the row labels that display along the 
left side of a comparative plot.

[Syntax: CFRAMETOP=color] 
          
Specifies the color to fill the frame area for the column labels that display across 
the top of a comparative plot.

[Syntax: CHREF=color] 
          
Specifies the color for horizontal axis reference lines requested by the HREF= option.

[Syntax: CINITIAL=value] 
          
Specifies the initial value for c-hat in the Newton-Raphson approximation of the 
maximum likelihood estimate of c for Weibull distributions requested with the 
WEIBULL or WEIBULL2 option. The default value is 1.8.

[Syntax: COLOR=color] 
          
Specifies the color of the curve or reference line associated with a distribution or 
kernel density estimate. Enclose the COLOR= option in parentheses after a distribution 
option or the KERNEL option. In a HISTOGRAM statement, you can specify a list of colors
in parentheses for multiple density curves.

[Syntax: CONTENTS='string'] 
      
Specifies the table of contents grouping entry for output produced by the plot statement. 
You can specify CONTENTS='' to suppress the grouping entry.

[Syntax: CPROP=color | EMPTY] 
          
Specifies the color for a horizontal bar whose length (relative to the width of the tile) 
indicates the proportion of the total frequency that is represented by the corresponding 
cell in a comparative plot.

[Syntax: CTEXT=color] 
          
Specifies the color for tick mark values and axis labels. The default is the color specified 
for the CTEXT= option in the GOPTIONS statement.

[Syntax: CTEXTSIDE=color] 
          
Specifies the color for the row labels that display along the left side of a comparative plot. 
By default, the color specified by the CTEXT= option is used. If you omit the CTEXT= option, the 
color specified in the GOPTIONS statement is used.

[Syntax: CTEXTTOP=color] 
          
Specifies the color for the column labels that display along the left side of a comparative plot. 
By default, the color specified by the CTEXT= option is used. If you omit the CTEXT= option, the 
color specified in the GOPTIONS statement is used.

[Syntax: CVREF=color] 
          
Specifies the color for lines requested with the VREF= option.

[Syntax: DESCRIPTION='string'] 
          
Specifies a description, up to 256 characters long, that appears in the PROC GREPLAY 
master menu for a traditional graphics chart. The default value is the analysis variable 
name.

[Syntax: FITINTERVAL=value] 
          
Specifies the value of z for the method of percentiles when this method is used to fit 
a Johnson sB or Johnson sU distribution. The FITINTERVAL= option is specified in parentheses 
after the SB or SU option. The default of z is 0.524.

Specifies the method used to estimate the parameters of a Johnson sB or Johnson sU 
distribution. The FITMETHOD= option is specified in parentheses after the SB or 
SU option. By default, the method of percentiles is used.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Method of percentiles.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Method of MLE.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: FITTOLERANCE=value] 
          
Specifies the tolerance value for the ratio criterion when the method of percentiles 
is used to fit a Johnson sB or Johnson sU distribution. The FITTOLERANCE= option is 
specified in parentheses after the SB or SU option. The default value is 0.01.

[Syntax: FONT=font] 
          
Specifies a software font for reference line and axis labels. You can also specify 
fonts for axis labels in an AXIS statement. The FONT= font takes precedence over the 
FTEXT= font specified in the GOPTIONS statement.

[Syntax: HAXIS=value] 
          
Specifies the name of an AXIS statement describing the horizontal axis.

[Syntax: HEIGHT=value] 
          
Specifies the height, in percentage screen units, of text for axis labels, tick mark 
labels, and legends. This option takes precedence over the HTEXT= option in the GOPTIONS 
statement.

[Syntax: HMINOR=n] 
          
Specifies the number of minor tick marks between each major tick mark on the horizontal 
axis. Minor tick marks are not labeled. By default, HMINOR=0.

[Syntax: HREFLABELS='label1' ...'labeln'] 
          
Specifies labels for the lines requested by the HREF= option. The number of labels 
must equal the number of lines. Enclose each label in quotes. Labels can have up to 
16 characters.
Specifies the vertical position of the HREFLABELS= labels.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Along top of plot
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Staggered from top to bottom of plot
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Staggered from bottom to top of plot

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: INFONT=font] 
          
Specifies a software font to use for text inside the framed areas of the plot. The INFONT= option 
takes precedence over the FTEXT= option in the GOPTIONS statement.

[Syntax: INHEIGHT=value] 
          
Specifies the height, in percentage screen units, of text used inside the framed 
areas of the histogram. By default, the height specified by the HEIGHT= option is 
used. If you do not specify the HEIGHT= option, the height specified with the HTEXT=
option in the GOPTIONS statement is used.

[Syntax: INTERTILE=value] 
          
Specifies the distance in horizontal percentage screen units between the framed areas, 
called tiles, of a comparative plot. By default, INTERTILE=0.75 percentage screen units. 
This option is not available unless you use the CLASS statement. You can specify INTERTILE=0 
to create contiguous tiles.

[Syntax: L=linetype] 
          
Specifies the line type of the curve or reference line associated with a distribution 
or kernel density estimate. Enclose the L= option in parentheses after the distribution 
option or the KERNEL option. In a HISTOGRAM statement, you can specify a list of line 
types in parentheses for multiple density curves.

[Syntax: LHREF=linetype] 
          
Specifies the line type for the reference lines that you request with the HREF= option. 
By default, LHREF=2, which produces a dashed line.

[Syntax: LVREF=linetype] 
          
Specifies the line type for lines requested with the VREF= option. By default, LVREF=2, 
which produces a dashed line.

[Syntax: MAXITER=n] 
          
Specifies the maximum number of iterations in the Newton-Raphson approximation of 
the maximum likelihood estimate of α for gamma distributions requested with the GAMMA 
option and c for Weibull distributions requested with the WEIBULL and WEIBULL2 options. 
Enclose the MAXITER= option in parentheses after the GAMMA, WEIBULL, or WEIBULL2 keywords. 
The default value of n is 20.

[Syntax: NAME='string'] 
          
Specifies a name for the plot, up to eight characters long, that appears in the 
PROC GREPLAY master menu for a traditional graphics chart. The default value is 
'UNIVAR'.

[Syntax: NCOLS=n] 
          
Specifies the number of columns per panel in a comparative plot. This option is not 
available unless you use the CLASS statement. By default, NCOLS=1 if you specify only 
one CLASS variable, and NCOLS=2 if you specify two CLASS variables. If you specify two 
CLASS variables, you can use the NCOLS= option with the NROWS= option.
Suppresses the frame around the subplot area.
Suppresses the label for the horizontal axis. You can use this option to reduce clutter.
Suppresses the label for the vertical axis. You can use this option to reduce clutter.

Suppresses the tick marks and tick mark labels for the vertical axis. This option also 
suppresses the label for the vertical axis.

[Syntax: NROWS=n] 
          
Specifies the number of rows per panel in a comparative plot. This option is not 
available unless you use the CLASS statement. By default, NROWS=2. If you specify 
two CLASS variables, you can use the NCOLS= option with the NROWS= option.

Specifies that plots associated with different levels of a CLASS variable be overlaid 
onto a single plot, rather than displayed as separate cells in a comparative plot.

[Syntax: SCALE=value] 
          
Is an alias for the SIGMA= option for distributions requested by the BETA, EXPONENTIAL, 
GAMMA, SB, SU, WEIBULL, and WEIBULL2 options and for the ZETA= option for distributions 
requested by the LOGNORMAL option.

[Syntax: SHAPE=value] 
          
Is an alias for the ALPHA= option for distributions requested by the GAMMA option, for 
the SIGMA= option for distributions requested by the LOGNORMAL option, and for the C= 
option for distributions requested by the WEIBULL and WEIBULL2 options.

Turns the characters in the vertical axis labels so that they display vertically. 
This happens by default when you use a hardware font.

[Syntax: VAXIS=name] 
          
Specifies the name of an AXIS statement describing the vertical axis. In a HISTOGRAM 
statement, you can alternatively specify a value-list for the vertical axis.

[Syntax: VAXISLABEL='label'] 
          
Specifies a label for the vertical axis. Labels can have up to 40 characters.

[Syntax: VMINOR=n] 
          
Specifies the number of minor tick marks between each major tick mark on the vertical 
axis. Minor tick marks are not labeled. The default is zero.

[Syntax: VREF=value-list] 
          
Draws reference lines perpendicular to the vertical axis at the values specified. Also 
see the CVREF= and LVREF= options.

[Syntax: VREFLABELS='label1'...'labeln'] 
          
Specifies labels for the lines requested by the VREF= option. The number of labels 
must equal the number of lines. Enclose each label in quotes. Labels can have up to 
16 characters.
Specifies the horizontal position of the VREFLABELS= labels.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Labels are positioned to the left of the plot.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Labels are positioned to the right of the plot.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: W=value | W=value-list] 
          
Specifies the width in pixels of the curve or reference line associated with a 
distribution or kernel density estimate. Enclose the W= option in parentheses 
after the distribution option or the KERNEL option. In a HISTOGRAM statement, 
you can specify a list of widths in parentheses for multiple density curves.

[Syntax: WAXIS=n] 
          
Specifies the line thickness, in pixels, for the axes and frame.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: COMPHISTOGRAM <variables > / CLASS=(class-variables) <options >; 

Creates a comparative histogram. You must specify at least one variable and either 
one or two class-variables (also referred to as classification variables). * The 
COMPHISTOGRAM statement displays a component histogram of the values of the variable 
for each level of the class-variables.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata: Displays labels above the histogram bars.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: The label shows the number of observations associated with a given bar.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: The label shows the percentage of observations represented by that bar.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: The label displays the proportion of observations associated with the bar.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: BARWIDTH=value] 
          
Specifies the width of the histogram bars in percentage screen units.)>

[Syntax: C=value-list | MISE] 
          
Specifies the standardized bandwidth parameter c for kernel density estimates requested
with the KERNEL option. 

C=MISE requests the bandwidth parameter that minimizes the estimated mean integrated 
square error (MISE).

Requests the bandwidth parameter that minimizes the estimated mean integrated 
square error (MISE).

[Syntax: CBARLINE=color] 
          
Specifies the color for the outline of the histogram bars when producing traditional graphics.

[Syntax: CFILL=color] 
          
Specifies the color to fill the bars of the histogram (or the area under a fitted 
density curve if you also specify the FILL option) when producing traditional 
graphics.

[Syntax: CFRAMENLEG=color | EMPTY] 
          
Specifies that the legend requested with the NLEGEND option (or the variable _TILELB_ 
in a CLASSSPEC= data set) is to be framed and that the frame is to be filled with the 
color indicated. 

CFRAMENLEG=EMPTY specifies that the legend requested with the NLEGEND option (or the 
variable _TILELB_ in a CLASSSPEC= data set) is to be framed but not filled with a color.

[Syntax: CFRAMENLEG=color | EMPTY] 
          
Specifies that the legend requested with the NLEGEND option (or the variable _TILELB_ 
in a CLASSSPEC= data set) is to be framed but not filled with a color.

[Syntax: CGRID=color] 
          
Specifies the color for grid lines requested with the GRID option.

[Syntax: CLASS=variable | CLASS=(variable1 variable2)] 
          
Specifies that a comparative histogram is to be created using the levels of the variables 
(also referred to as class-variables or classification variables).

Syntax: CLASSKEY='value' | CLASSKEY=('value1' 'value2')
          
Specifies that a comparative histogram is to be created using the levels of the 
variables (also referred to as class-variables or classification variables).

[Syntax: CLASSSPEC=SAS-data-set] 
          
Specifies a data set that provides distinct specification limits for each cell, 
as well as a color, legend, and label for the corresponding tile.

Specifies that histogram bars are clipped at the upper and lower specification 
limit lines when there are no observations outside the specification limits.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: The histogram bar is truncated at the specification limit.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: The portion of a filled histogram bar outside the specification limit is left unfilled.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata: Specifies that histogram interval endpoints, rather than midpoints, are aligned with horizontal axis tick marks, and specifies how the endpoints are determined.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: The values must be listed in increasing order and must be evenly spaced. The difference between  consecutive endpoints is used as the width of the histogram bars
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: The procedure first determines the endpoints for the data in the key cell. The initial number of  endpoints is based on the number of observations in the key cell by using the method of Terrell  and Scott (1985).
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: The procedure determines the endpoints by using all the observations as if there were no cells.  In other words, the number of endpoints is computed from the total sample size by using the method  of Terrell and Scott (1985).

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Fills areas under a fitted density curve with colors and patterns. Enclose the FILL 
option in parentheses after the keyword NORMAL or KERNEL.

Draws reference lines requested with the HREF= and VREF= options in front of the 
histogram bars.
Displays a grid to the comparative histogram.

[Syntax: HOFFSET=value] 
          
Specifies the offset, in percentage screen units, at both ends of the horizontal axis.

Specifies the kernel function (normal, quadratic, or triangular) used to compute 
a kernel density estimates requested with the KERNEL option.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Normal kernel function
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Quadratic kernel function

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: KERNEL<(kernel-options)>] 
          
Requests a kernel density estimate for each cell of the comparative histogram. 
You can specify the kernel-options described below: 

FILL -- specifies that the area under the curve is to be filled 
COLOR= -- specifies the color of the curve 
L= -- specifies the line style for the curve 
W= -- specifies the width of the curve 
K= --  specifies the type of kernel 
C= -- specifies the smoothing parameter 
LOWER= -- specifies the lower bound for the curve 
UPPER= -- specifies the upper bound for the curve

[Syntax: LOWER=value] 
          
Specifies the lower bound for a kernel density estimate curve. Enclose the LOWER= 
option in parentheses after the KERNEL option.

[Syntax: LGRID=linetype] 
          
Specifies the line type for the grid requested with the GRID option.

[Syntax: MAXNBIN=n] 
          
Specifies the maximum number of bins to be displayed.

[Syntax: MAXSIGMAS=value] 
          
Limits the number of bins to be displayed to a range of value standard deviations 
(of the data in the key cell) above and below the mean of the data in the key cell.

[Syntax: MIDPOINTS=values | KEY | UNIFORM] 
          
Specifies how to determine the midpoints for the histogram intervals, where values 
determines the width of the histogram bars as the difference between consecutive 
midpoints.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: The values must be listed in increasing order and must be evenly spaced. The difference between consecutive midpoints is used as the width of the histogram bars.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: The procedure first determines the midpoints for the data in the key cell. The initial number of midpoints is based on the number of observations in the key cell by using the method of Terrell and Scott (1985).  The midpoint list for the key cell is then extended in either direction as necessary until it spans the data in the remaining cells.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: The procedure determines the midpoints using all the observations as if there were no cells. In other words,  the number of midpoints is computed from the total sample size by using the method of Terrell and Scott (1985).

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Specifies that missing values of the first CLASS= variable are to be treated as 
a level of the CLASS= variable.

Specifies that missing values of the second CLASS= variable are to be treated as 
a level of the CLASS= variable.

[Syntax: MU=value] 
          
Specifies the parameter, µ,  for normal density curves requested with the NORMAL option.

[Syntax: NLEGEND<='label'>] 
          
Specifies the form of a legend that is displayed inside each tile and indicates the sample size of 
the cell. The following two forms are available: 

o If you specify the NLEGEND option, the form is N=n where n is the cell sample size. 

o If you specify the NLEGEND='label' option, the form is label=n where n is the cell 
  sample size.  The label can be up to 16 characters and must be enclosed in quotes. 
  For instance, you might specify NLEGEND='Number of Parts' to request a label of the 
  form Number of Parts = n.

Specifies the position of the legend requested with the NLEGEND option or the variable 
_TILELB_ in a CLASSSPEC= data set.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: The legend is displayed in the northwest corner of the tile
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: The legend is displayed in the northeast corner of the tile.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata: Suppresses the display of the bars in a comparative histogram.
Suppresses the creation of a comparative histogram. This is an alias for NOPLOT.

Suppresses the rearrangement of cells that occurs by default when you use the CLASSKEY= 
option to specify the key cell.
Suppresses the creation of a comparative histogram.

[Syntax: NORMAL<(normal-options)>] 
          
Displays a normal density curve for each cell of the comparative histogram.

The following normal-options can be specified:

COLOR=color -- specifies color of normal curve 
FILL -- fills area under normal curve 
L=linetype -- specifies line type of normal curve 
MU=value -- specifies mean μ for fitted normal curve 
SIGMA=value -- specifies standard deviation σ for fitted normal curve 
W= -- specifies width of normal curve
Specifies the display order for the values of the first CLASS= variable.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: The rows (columns) are displayed from top to bottom (left to right) in increasing order of the  internal (unformatted) values of the first CLASS= variable.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: The rows (columns) are displayed from top to bottom (left to right) in increasing order of the  formatted values of the first CLASS= variable.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: The rows (columns) are displayed from top to bottom (left to right) in the order in which the  values of the first CLASS= variable first appear in the input data set.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: The rows (columns) are displayed from top to bottom (left to right) in order of decreasing  frequency count.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata: Specifies the display order for the values of the second CLASS= variable.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: The rows (columns) are displayed from top to bottom (left to right) in increasing order of the  internal (unformatted) values of the first CLASS= variable.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: The rows (columns) are displayed from top to bottom (left to right) in increasing order of the  formatted values of the first CLASS= variable.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: The rows (columns) are displayed from top to bottom (left to right) in the order in which the  values of the first CLASS= variable first appear in the input data set.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: The rows (columns) are displayed from top to bottom (left to right) in order of decreasing  frequency count.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: OUTHISTOGRAM=SAS-data-set] 
          
Creates a SAS data set that saves the midpoints or endpoints of the histogram 
intervals, the observed percent of observations in each interval, and (optionally) 
the percent of observations in each interval estimated from a fitted normal 
distribution.

[Syntax: PFILL=pattern] 
          
Specifies a pattern used to fill the bars of the histograms (or the areas under 
a fitted curve if you also specify the FILL option) when producing traditional 
graphics.
Includes the right endpoint of each histogram interval in that interval.

[Syntax: SIGMA=value] 
          
Specifies the parameter, σ, for normal density curves requested with the NORMAL option.

[Syntax: TILELEGLABEL='label'] 
          
Specifies a label displayed to the left of the legend that is created when you provide 
_CTILE_ and _TILELG_ variables in a CLASSSPEC= data set. The label can be up to 16 
characters and must be enclosed in quotes. The default label is Tiles:.

[Syntax: UPPER=value] 
          
Specifies the upper bound for a kernel density estimate curve.

[Syntax: VOFFSET=value] 
          
Specifies the offset, in percentage screen units, at the upper end of the vertical axis.
Specifies the scale of the vertical axis.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Scales the data in units of percent of observations per data unit. This is the default.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Scales the data in units of the number of observations per data unit.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Scales the data in units of proportion of observations per data unit.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: WBARLINE=n] 
          
Specifies the width of bar outlines. By default, n=1.

[Syntax: WGRID=n] 
          
Specifies the width of the grid lines requested with the GRID option.

[Syntax: ALPHADELTA=value] 
          
Specifies the change in successive estimates of α-hat at which iteration terminates in the 
Newton-Raphson approximation of the maximum likelihood estimate of α for gamma distributions 
requested with the GAMMA option.

[Syntax: ALPHAINITIAL=value] 
          
Specifies the initial value for α-hat in the Newton-Raphson approximation of the maximum likelihood 
estimate of α for gamma distributions requested with the GAMMA option. Enclose the ALPHAINITIAL= option 
in parentheses after the GAMMA keyword.
Applies the annotation requested with the ANNOTATE= option only to the key cell of a comparative plot.

[Syntax: ANNOTATE=SAS-data-set] 
          
Specifies an input data set that contains annotate variables.

[Syntax: CAXIS=color] 
          
Specifies the color for the axes and tick marks.

[Syntax: CDELTA=value] 
          
Specifies the change in successive estimates of c at which iterations terminate in 
the Newton-Raphson approximation of the maximum likelihood estimate of c for Weibull 
distributions requested by the WEIBULL option. Enclose the CDELTA= option in parentheses 
after the WEIBULL keyword. Iteration continues until the change in c between consecutive 
steps is less than the value specified or until the number of iterations exceeds the value 
of the MAXITER= option. The default value is 0.00001.

[Syntax: CFRAME=color] 
          
Specifies the color for the area that is enclosed by the axes and frame. The area 
is not filled by default.

[Syntax: CFRAMESIDE=color] 
          
Specifies the color to fill the frame area for the row labels that display along the 
left side of a comparative plot.

[Syntax: CFRAMETOP=color] 
          
Specifies the color to fill the frame area for the column labels that display across 
the top of a comparative plot.

[Syntax: CHREF=color] 
          
Specifies the color for horizontal axis reference lines requested by the HREF= option.

[Syntax: CINITIAL=value] 
          
Specifies the initial value for c-hat in the Newton-Raphson approximation of the 
maximum likelihood estimate of c for Weibull distributions requested with the 
WEIBULL or WEIBULL2 option. The default value is 1.8.

[Syntax: COLOR=color] 
          
Specifies the color of the curve or reference line associated with a distribution or  
kernel density estimate. Enclose the COLOR= option in parentheses after a distribution 
option or the KERNEL option. In a HISTOGRAM statement, you can specify a list of colors
in parentheses for multiple density curves.

[Syntax: CONTENTS='string'] 
      
Specifies the table of contents grouping entry for output produced by the plot 
statement. You can specify CONTENTS='' to suppress the grouping entry.

[Syntax: CPROP=color | EMPTY] 
          
Specifies the color for a horizontal bar whose length (relative to the width of the 
tile) indicates the proportion of the total frequency that is represented by the 
corresponding cell in a comparative plot.

[Syntax: CTEXT=color] 
          
Specifies the color for tick mark values and axis labels. The default is the color 
specified for the CTEXT= option in the GOPTIONS statement.

[Syntax: CTEXTSIDE=color] 
          
Specifies the color for the row labels that display along the left side of a comparative 
plot. By default, the color specified by the CTEXT= option is used. If you omit the CTEXT= 
option, the color specified in the GOPTIONS statement is used.

[Syntax: CTEXTTOP=color] 
          
Specifies the color for the column labels that display along the left side of a comparative 
plot. By default, the color specified by the CTEXT= option is used. If you omit the CTEXT= 
option, the color specified in the GOPTIONS statement is used.

[Syntax: CVREF=color] 
          
Specifies the color for lines requested with the VREF= option.

[Syntax: DESCRIPTION='string'] 
          
Specifies a description, up to 256 characters long, that appears in the PROC GREPLAY 
master menu for a traditional graphics chart. The default value is the analysis variable 
name.

[Syntax: FITINTERVAL=value] 
          
Specifies the value of z for the method of percentiles when this method is used to 
fit a Johnson sB or Johnson sU distribution. The FITINTERVAL= option is specified 
in parentheses after the SB or SU option. The default of z is 0.524.

Specifies the method used to estimate the parameters of a Johnson sB or Johnson sU distribution. 
The FITMETHOD= option is specified in parentheses after the SB or SU option. By default, the 
method of percentiles is used.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Method of percentiles.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Method of MLE.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: FITTOLERANCE=value] 
          
Specifies the tolerance value for the ratio criterion when the method of percentiles 
is used to fit a Johnson sB or Johnson sU distribution. The FITTOLERANCE= option is 
specified in parentheses after the SB or SU option. The default value is 0.01.

[Syntax: FONT=font] 
          
Specifies a software font for reference line and axis labels. You can also specify 
fonts for axis labels in an AXIS statement. The FONT= font takes precedence over the 
FTEXT= font specified in the GOPTIONS statement.

[Syntax: HAXIS=value] 
          
Specifies the name of an AXIS statement describing the horizontal axis.

[Syntax: HEIGHT=value] 
          
Specifies the height, in percentage screen units, of text for axis labels, tick mark 
labels, and legends. This option takes precedence over the HTEXT= option in the GOPTIONS 
statement.

[Syntax: HMINOR=n] 
          
Specifies the number of minor tick marks between each major tick mark on the horizontal 
axis. Minor tick marks are not labeled. By default, HMINOR=0.

[Syntax: HREFLABELS='label1' ...'labeln'] 
          
Specifies labels for the lines requested by the HREF= option. The number of labels 
must equal the number of lines. Enclose each label in quotes. Labels can have up to 
16 characters.
Specifies the vertical position of the HREFLABELS= labels.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Along top of plot
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Staggered from top to bottom of plot
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Staggered from bottom to top of plot

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: INFONT=font] 
          
Specifies a software font to use for text inside the framed areas of the plot. The 
INFONT= option takes precedence over the FTEXT= option in the GOPTIONS statement.

[Syntax: INHEIGHT=value] 
          
Specifies the height, in percentage screen units, of text used inside the framed areas 
of the histogram. By default, the height specified by the HEIGHT= option is used. If you 
do not specify the HEIGHT= option, the height specified with the HTEXT= option in the 
GOPTIONS statement is used.

[Syntax: INTERTILE=value] 
          
Specifies the distance in horizontal percentage screen units between the framed areas, 
called tiles, of a comparative plot. By default, INTERTILE=0.75 percentage screen units. 
This option is not available unless you use the CLASS statement. You can specify INTERTILE=0 
to create contiguous tiles.

[Syntax: L=linetype] 
          
Specifies the line type of the curve or reference line associated with a distribution 
or kernel density estimate. Enclose the L= option in parentheses after the distribution 
option or the KERNEL option. In a HISTOGRAM statement, you can specify a list of line 
types in parentheses for multiple density curves.

[Syntax: linetype] 
          
Specifies the line type for the reference lines that you request with the HREF= 
option. By default, LHREF=2, which produces a dashed line.

[Syntax: LVREF=linetype] 
          
Specifies the line type for lines requested with the VREF= option. By default, LVREF=2, 
which produces a dashed line.

[Syntax: MAXITER=n] 
          
Specifies the maximum number of iterations in the Newton-Raphson approximation 
of the maximum likelihood estimate of α for gamma distributions requested with 
the GAMMA option and c for Weibull distributions requested with the WEIBULL and 
WEIBULL2 options. Enclose the MAXITER= option in parentheses after the GAMMA, 
WEIBULL, or WEIBULL2 keywords. The default value of n is 20.

[Syntax: NAME='string'] 
          
Specifies a name for the plot, up to eight characters long, that appears in the 
PROC GREPLAY master menu for a traditional graphics chart. The default value is 
'UNIVAR'.

[Syntax: NCOLS=n] 
          
Specifies the number of columns per panel in a comparative plot. This option is not 
available unless you use the CLASS statement. By default, NCOLS=1 if you specify only 
one CLASS variable, and NCOLS=2 if you specify two CLASS variables. If you specify two 
CLASS variables, you can use the NCOLS= option with the NROWS= option.
Suppresses the frame around the subplot area.
Suppresses the label for the horizontal axis. You can use this option to reduce clutter.
Suppresses the label for the vertical axis. You can use this option to reduce clutter.

Suppresses the tick marks and tick mark labels for the vertical axis. This option 
also suppresses the label for the vertical axis.

[Syntax: NROWS=n] 
          
Specifies the number of rows per panel in a comparative plot. This option is not 
available unless you use the CLASS statement. By default, NROWS=2. If you specify 
two CLASS variables, you can use the NCOLS= option with the NROWS= option.

Specifies that plots associated with different levels of a CLASS variable be overlaid onto a single 
plot, rather than displayed as separate cells in a comparative plot.

[Syntax: SCALE=value] 
          
Is an alias for the SIGMA= option for distributions requested by the BETA, EXPONENTIAL, 
GAMMA, SB, SU, WEIBULL, and WEIBULL2 options and for the ZETA= option for distributions 
requested by the LOGNORMAL option.

[Syntax: SHAPE=value] 
          
Is an alias for the ALPHA= option for distributions requested by the GAMMA option, for 
the SIGMA= option for distributions requested by the LOGNORMAL option, and for the C= 
option for distributions requested by the WEIBULL and WEIBULL2 options.

Turns the characters in the vertical axis labels so that they display vertically. 
This happens by default when you use a hardware font.

[Syntax: VAXIS=name] 
          
Specifies the name of an AXIS statement describing the vertical axis. In a HISTOGRAM 
statement, you can alternatively specify a value-list for the vertical axis.

[Syntax: VAXISLABEL='label'] 
          
Specifies a label for the vertical axis. Labels can have up to 40 characters.

[Syntax: VMINOR=n] 
          
Specifies the number of minor tick marks between each major tick mark on the vertical 
axis. Minor tick marks are not labeled. The default is zero.

[Syntax: VREF=value-list] 
          
Draws reference lines perpendicular to the vertical axis at the values specified. Also 
see the CVREF= and LVREF= options.

[Syntax: VREFLABELS='label1'...'labeln'] 
          
Specifies labels for the lines requested by the VREF= option. The number of labels must 
equal the number of lines. Enclose each label in quotes. Labels can have up to 16 characters.
Specifies the horizontal position of the VREFLABELS= labels.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Labels are positioned at the left of the plot.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Labels are positioned at the right of the plot.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: W=value | W=value-list] 
          
Specifies the width in pixels of the curve or reference line associated with a distribution 
or kernel density estimate. Enclose the W= option in parentheses after the distribution option 
or the KERNEL option. In a HISTOGRAM statement, you can specify a list of widths in parentheses 
for multiple density curves.

[Syntax: WAXIS=n] 
          
Specifies the line thickness, in pixels, for the axes and frame.

[Syntax: ALPHA=value] 
          
Specifies the shape parameter α (α > 0) for distribution functions requested with the BETA and 
GAMMA options.
Displays labels above the histogram bars.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: The label shows the number of observations associated with a given bar.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: The label shows the percentage of observations represented by that bar.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: The label displays the proportion of observations associated with the bar.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: BETA<(beta-options)>] 
          
Displays a fitted beta density curve on the histogram.
          
You can specify the following beta-options: 

  ALPHA=value -- specifies first shape parameter, α, for beta distribution function 
  BETA=value -- specifies second shape parameter, β, for beta distribution function 
  SIGMA=value -- specifies scale parameter, σ, for beta distribution function 
  THETA=value -- specifies lower threshold parameter, θ, for beta distribution function 
  COLOR=color -- specifies color of fitted density curve 
  FILL -- fills area under fitted density curve 
  INDICES -- calculates capability indices based on fitted distribution 
  L=linetype -- specifies line type of fitted curve 
  MIDPERCENTS -- prints table of midpoints of histogram intervals 
  NOPRINT -- suppresses printed output summarizing fitted curve 
  PERCENTS=value-list -- lists percents for which quantiles calculated from data and quantiles 
    estimated from fitted curve are tabulated 
  SYMBOL='character' -- specifies character used for fitted density curve in line printer plots 
  W= -- specifies width of fitted density curve

[Syntax: BETA=value-list] 
          
Specifies the second shape parameter, β, for beta distribution functions requested 
by the BETA option.

[Syntax: BMCFILL=color] 
          
Specifies the fill color for a box-and-whisker plot in a bottom margin requested 
with the BMPLOT= option.

[Syntax: BMCFRAME=color] 
          
Specifies the color for filling the frame of a bottom margin plot requested with the 
BMPLOT= option.

[Syntax: BMCOLOR=color] 
          
Specifies the color of a carpet plot or dot plot, or the outline color of a box-and-whisker plot, 
in a bottom margin plot requested with the BMPLOT= option.

[Syntax: BMMARGIN=height] 
          
Specifies the height in screen percentage units of a bottom margin plot requested with 
the BMPLOT= option.
Produces a carpet plot, dot plot, or box-and-whisker plot along the bottom margin of a histogram.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: A carpet plot represents each observation with a vertical line.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: A dot plot marks each observation with a symbol.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: A box-and-whisker plot is produced with whiskers extending to the minimum and maximum values.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: A schematic box-and-whisker plot is produced. In a schematic box-and-whisker plot,  the whiskers extend to the smallest value within the lower fence and the largest  value within the upper fence.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: C=value-list | MISE] 
          
Specifies the shape parameter c for Weibull density curves requested with the WEIBULL option. 

C=MISE requests the standardized bandwidth parameter that minimizes the estimated mean 
integrated square error (MISE).

Requests the standardized bandwidth parameter that minimizes the estimated mean 
integrated square error (MISE).

[Syntax: CBARLINE=color] 
          
Specifies the color for the outline of histogram bars.

[Syntax: CFILL=color] 
          
Specifies the color to fill the bars of the histogram (or the area under a fitted 
density curve if you also specify the FILL option).

Specifies that histogram bars are clipped at the upper and lower specification limit 
lines when there are no observations outside the specification limits.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: The histogram bar is truncated at the specification limit.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: The portion of a filled histogram bar outside the specification limit is left unfilled.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: CURVELEGEND=name | NONE] 
          
Specifies the name of a LEGEND statement describing the legend for specification 
limits and fitted curves. 

CURVELEGEND=NONE suppresses the legend for fitted curves; this is equivalent to 
specifying the NOCURVELEGEND option.
Suppresses the legend for fitted curves; this is equivalent to specifying the NOCURVELEGEND option.

[Syntax: DELTA=value-list] 
          
Specifies the first shape parameter, delta, for Johnson SB and Johnson SU density curves requested 
with the SB and SU options.

Specifies that histogram interval endpoints, rather than midpoints, are aligned with 
horizontal axis tick marks. The number of histogram intervals is based on the number 
of observations by using the method of Terrell and Scott (1985).

[Syntax: ENDPOINTS=value-list] 
          
Specifies that histogram interval endpoints, rather than midpoints, are aligned 
with horizontal axis tick marks. The values must be listed in increasing order 
and must be evenly spaced. All observations in the input data set, as well as 
any specification limits, must lie between the first and last values specified.

[Syntax: EXPONENTIAL<(exponential-options)>] 
          
Displays a fitted exponential density curve on the histogram.
          
Description of exponential-options:

  SIGMA=value -- specifies scale parameter, σ, for exponential distribution function 
  THETA=value -- specifies threshold parameter, θ,  for exponential distribution function 
  COLOR=color -- specifies color of fitted density curve 
  FILL -- fills area under fitted density curve 
  INDICES -- calculates capability indices based on fitted distribution 
  L=linetype -- specifies line type of fitted curve 
  MIDPERCENTS -- prints table of midpoints of histogram intervals 
  NOPRINT -- suppresses printed output summarizing fitted curve 
  PERCENTS=value-list -- lists percents for which quantiles calculated from data and quantiles estimated 
    from fitted curve are tabulated 
  SYMBOL='character' -- specifies character used for fitted density curve in line printer plots 
  W= -- specifies width of fitted density curve

Fills areas under a parametric density curve or kernel density estimate with colors 
and patterns.
Forces the creation of a histogram if there is only one unique observation.
Draws reference lines requested with the HREF= and VREF= options in front of the histogram bars.

[Syntax: GAMMA<(gamma-options)>] 
          
Displays a fitted γ density curve on the histogram.
          
You can specify the following gamma-options:

  ALPHADELTA=value -- specifies change in successive estimates of α at which the Newton-Raphson 
    approximation of α-hat terminates 
  ALPHAINITIAL=value -- specifies initial value for α in the Newton-Raphson approximation of α-hat 
  MAXITER= -- specifies maximum number of iterations in the Newton-Raphson approximation of α-hat 
  SIGMA=value -- specifies scale parameter, σ, for fitted gamma curve 
  ALPHA=value -- specifies shape parameter, α,  for fitted gamma curve 
  THETA=value -- specifies threshold parameter, θ, for fitted gamma curve
  COLOR= -- specifies colors of density curves 
  CONTENTS= -- specifies table of contents entry for density curve grouping 
  FILL -- fills area under density curve 
  L= -- specifies line types of density curves 
  MIDPERCENTS -- prints table of midpoints of histogram intervals  
  NOPRINT -- suppresses tables summarizing curves 
  PERCENTS= -- lists percents for which quantiles calculated from data and quantiles estimated from curves are tabulated 
  W= -- specifies widths of density curves

[Syntax: GAMMA=value-list] 
          
Specifies the second shape parameter, γ,  for Johnson SB and Johnson SU distribution 
functions requested with the SB and SU options.
Requests a hanging histogram,

[Syntax: HOFFSET=value] 
          
Specifies the offset, in percentage screen units, at both ends of the horizontal axis.
Requests capability indices based on the fitted distribution.
Specifies the kernel function (normal, quadratic, or triangular) used to compute a kernel density estimate.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Normal kernel function
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Quadratic kernel function

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: KERNEL<(kernel-options)>] 
          
Superimposes up to five kernel density estimates on the histogram. 

You can specify the kernel-options described below: 

  FILL -- specifies that the area under the curve is to be filled 
  COLOR= -- specifies the color of the curve 
  L= -- specifies the line style for the curve 
  W= -- specifies the width of the curve 
  K= -- specifies the type of kernel 
  C= -- specifies the smoothing parameter 
  LOWER= -- specifies the lower bound for the curve 
  UPPER= -- specifies the upper bound for the curve

[Syntax: LEGEND=name | NONE] 
          
Specifies the name of a LEGEND statement describing the legend for specification limit reference 
lines and fitted curves. 

LEGEND=NONE suppresses all legend information, and is equivalent to specifying the NOLEGEND option.
Suppresses all legend information, and is equivalent to specifying the NOLEGEND option.

[Syntax: LOGNORMAL<(lognormal-options)>] 
          
Displays a fitted lognormal density curve on the histogram.
          
You can specify the following lognormal-options:

  ZETA=value -- specifies scale parameter, ζ, for fitted lognormal curve 
  SIGMA=value -- specifies shape parameter, σ, for fitted lognormal curve 
  THETA=value -- specifies threshold parameter, θ, for fitted lognormal curve
  COLOR= -- specifies colors of density curves 
  CONTENTS= -- specifies table of contents entry for density curve grouping 
  FILL -- fills area under density curve 
  L= -- specifies line types of density curves 
  MIDPERCENTS -- prints table of midpoints of histogram intervals  
  NOPRINT -- suppresses tables summarizing curves 
  PERCENTS= -- lists percents for which quantiles calculated from data and quantiles 
    estimated from curves are tabulated 
  W= -- specifies widths of density curves

[Syntax: LOWER=value] 
          
Specifies lower bounds for kernel density estimates requested with the KERNEL option.
Requests a table listing the midpoints and percentage of observations in each histogram interval.

[Syntax: MIDPOINTS=values | KEY | UNIFORM] 
          
Specifies how to determine the midpoints for the histogram intervals, where value-list determines the
width of the histogram bars as the difference between consecutive midpoints.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: The values must be listed in increasing order and must be evenly spaced. The difference  between consecutive midpoints is used as the width of the histogram bars.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: The procedure first determines the midpoints for the data in the key cell. The  initial number of midpoints is based on the number of observations in the key  cell by using the method of Terrell and Scott (1985). The midpoint list for the  key cell is then extended in either direction as necessary until it spans the  data in the remaining cells.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: The procedure determines the midpoints using all the observations as if there were  no cells. In other words, the number of midpoints is computed from the total sample  size by using the method of Terrell and Scott (1985).

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: MIDPTAXIS=name] 
          
Is an alias for the HAXIS= option.

[Syntax: MU=value-list] 
          
Specifies the parameter, µ, for normal density curves requested with the 
NORMAL option.

[Syntax: NENDPOINTS=n] 
          
Specifies the number of histogram interval endpoints and causes the endpoints, 
rather than interval midpoints, to be aligned with horizontal axis tick marks.

[Syntax: NMIDPOINTS=n] 
          
Specifies the number of histogram intervals.
Suppresses drawing of histogram bars.
Suppresses the portion of the legend for fitted curves.
Suppresses legends for specification limits, fitted curves, distribution lines, and hidden observations.
Suppresses the creation of a plot.
Suppresses printed output summarizing the fitted curve.

[Syntax: NORMAL<(normal-options)>] 
          
Displays a fitted normal density curve on the histogram.

The following normal-options can be specified:

  MU=value -- specifies mean µ for fitted normal curve 
  SIGMA=value -- specifies standard deviation, σ, for fitted normal curve
  COLOR=color -- specifies color of fitted density curve 
  FILL -- fills area under fitted density curve 
  INDICES -- calculates capability indices based on fitted distribution 
  L=linetype -- specifies line type of fitted curve 
  MIDPERCENTS -- prints table of midpoints of histogram intervals 
  NOPRINT -- suppresses printed output summarizing fitted curve 
  PERCENTS=value-list -- lists percents for which quantiles calculated from data and 
    quantiles estimated from fitted curve are tabulated 
  SYMBOL='character' -- specifies character used for fitted density curve in line printer plots 
  W= -- specifies width of fitted density curve
Suppresses the portion of the legend for specification limit reference lines.

[Syntax: OUTFIT=SAS-data-set] 
          
Creates a SAS data set that contains parameter estimates for fitted curves and related goodness-of-fit 
information.

[Syntax: OUTHISTOGRAM=SAS-data-set] 
          
Creates a SAS data set that contains information about histogram intervals.

[Syntax: PCTAXIS=namevalue-list] 
          
Is an alias for the VAXIS= option.

[Syntax: PERCENTS=value-list] 
          
Specifies a list of percents for which quantiles calculated from the data and 
quantiles estimated from the fitted curve are tabulated.

[Syntax: PFILL=pattern] 
          
Specifies a pattern used to fill the bars of the histograms (or the areas under 
a fitted curve if you also specify the FILL option) when producing traditional 
graphics.
Includes the right endpoint of each histogram interval in that interval.

[Syntax: SB<(SB-options)>] 
          
Displays a fitted Johnson SB density curve on the histogram.
          
You can specify the following SB-options:

  DELTA=value-list -- specifies first shape parameter delta for fitted SB curve 
  FITINTERVAL=value -- specifies z-value for method of percentiles 
  FITMETHOD=MLE| PERCENTILE| MOMENTS -- specifies method of parameter estimation 
  GAMMA=value-list -- specifies second shape parameter γ for fitted SB curve 
  SIGMA=value-list -- specifies scale parameter σ for fitted SB curve 
  THETA=value-list -- specifies lower threshold parameter θ for fitted SB curve 
  FITTOLERANCE=value -- specifies tolerance for method of percentiles 
  COLOR=color -- specifies color of fitted density curve 
  FILL -- fills area under fitted density curve 
  INDICES -- calculates capability indices based on fitted distribution 
  L=linetype -- specifies line type of fitted curve 
  MIDPERCENTS -- prints table of midpoints of histogram intervals 
  NOPRINT -- suppresses printed output summarizing fitted curve 
  PERCENTS=value-list -- lists percents for which quantiles calculated from data and 
    quantiles estimated from fitted curve are tabulated 
  SYMBOL='character' -- specifies character used for fitted density curve in line printer plots 
  W= -- specifies width of fitted density curve

[Syntax: SIGMA=value] 
          
Specifies the parameter, σ, for curves requested with the BETA, EXPONENTIAL, GAMMA, LOGNORMAL, 
NORMAL, SB, SU, and WEIBULL options.

[Syntax: SPECLEGEND=name | NONE] 
          
Specifies the name of a LEGEND statement describing the legend for specification 
limits and fitted curves. 

SPECLEGEND=NONE suppresses the portion of the legend for specification limit references 
lines, is equivalent to specifying the NOSPECLEGEND option.

Suppresses the portion of the legend for specification limit references lines, 
is equivalent to specifying the NOSPECLEGEND option.

[Syntax: SB<(SB-options)>] 
          
Displays a fitted Johnson SU density curve on the histogram.
          
You can specify the following SU-options:

  DELTA=value-list -- specifies first shape parameter delta for fitted SU curve 
  FITINTERVAL=value -- specifies z-value for method of percentiles 
  FITMETHOD=MLE| PERCENTILE| MOMENTS -- specifies method of parameter estimation 
  GAMMA=value-list -- specifies second shape parameter γ for fitted SU curve 
  SIGMA=value-list -- specifies scale parameter σ for fitted SB curve 
  THETA=value-list -- specifies lower threshold parameter θ for fitted SU curve 
  FITTOLERANCE=value -- specifies tolerance for method of percentiles 
  COLOR=color -- specifies color of fitted density curve 
  FILL -- fills area under fitted density curve 
  INDICES -- calculates capability indices based on fitted distribution 
  L=linetype -- specifies line type of fitted curve 
  MIDPERCENTS -- prints table of midpoints of histogram intervals 
  NOPRINT -- suppresses printed output summarizing fitted curve 
  PERCENTS=value-list -- lists percents for which quantiles calculated from data and 
    quantiles estimated from fitted curve are tabulated 
  SYMBOL='character' -- specifies character used for fitted density curve in line printer plots 
  W= -- specifies width of fitted density curve

[Syntax: SYMBOL='character'] 
          
Specifies the character used for the density curve or kernel density curve in line 
printer plots.

[Syntax: THETA=value-list] 
          
Specifies the lower threshold parameter, θ, for curves requested with the BETA, 
EXPONENTIAL, GAMMA, LOGNORMAL, SB, and WEIBULL options, and the location parameter, 
θ, for curves requested with the SU option.

[Syntax: UPPER=value] 
          
Specifies the upper bound for kernel density estimates requested with the 
KERNEL option.
Specifies the scale of the vertical axis.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Scales the data in units of percent of observations per data unit. This is the default.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Scales the data in units of the number of observations per data unit.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Scales the data in units of proportion of observations per data unit.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: WBARLINE=n] 
          
Specifies the width of bar outlines. By default, n=1.

[Syntax: WEIBULL<(Weibull-options)>] 
          
Displays a fitted Weibull density curve on the histogram.
          
You can specify the following Weibull-options:

  C=value-list -- specifies shape parameter c for fitted Weibull curve 
  CDELTA=value -- specifies change in successive estimates of c at which the Newton-Raphson 
    approximation of c-hat terminates 
  CINITIAL=value -- specifies initial value for c in Newton-Raphson approximation of c-hat
  MAXITER= -- specifies maximum number of iterations in Newton-Raphson approximation of c-hat 
  SIGMA=value-list -- specifies scale parameter σ for fitted Weibull curve 
  THETA=value-list -- specifies threshold parameter θ for fitted Weibull curve 
  COLOR=color -- specifies color of fitted density curve 
  FILL -- fills area under fitted density curve 
  INDICES -- calculates capability indices based on fitted distribution 
  L=linetype -- specifies line type of fitted curve 
  MIDPERCENTS -- prints table of midpoints of histogram intervals 
  NOPRINT -- suppresses printed output summarizing fitted curve 
  PERCENTS=value-list -- lists percents for which quantiles calculated from data and quantiles 
    estimated from fitted curve are tabulated 
  SYMBOL='character' -- specifies character used for fitted density curve in line printer plots 
  W= -- specifies width of fitted density curve

[Syntax: ZETA=value-list] 
          
 Specifies a value for the scale parameter, ζ, for lognormal density curves requested 
 with the LOGNORMAL option.

[Syntax: ALPHADELTA=value] 
          
Specifies the change in successive estimates of α-hat at which iteration terminates 
in the Newton-Raphson approximation of the maximum likelihood estimate of α for gamma 
distributions requested with the GAMMA option.

[Syntax: ALPHAINITIAL=value] 
          
Specifies the initial value for α-hat in the Newton-Raphson approximation of the 
maximum likelihood estimate of α for gamma distributions requested with the GAMMA 
option. Enclose the ALPHAINITIAL= option in parentheses after the GAMMA keyword.

Applies the annotation requested with the ANNOTATE= option only to the key cell of 
a comparative plot.

[Syntax: ANNOTATE=SAS-data-set] 
          
Specifies an input data set that contains annotate variables.

[Syntax: CAXIS=color] 
          
Specifies the color for the axes and tick marks.

[Syntax: CDELTA=value] 
          
Specifies the change in successive estimates of c at which iterations terminate in 
the Newton-Raphson approximation of the maximum likelihood estimate of c for Weibull 
distributions requested by the WEIBULL option. Enclose the CDELTA= option in parentheses 
after the WEIBULL keyword. Iteration continues until the change in c between consecutive 
steps is less than the value specified or until the number of iterations exceeds the 
value of the MAXITER= option. The default value is 0.00001.

[Syntax: CFRAME=color] 
          
Specifies the color for the area that is enclosed by the axes and frame. The area 
is not filled by default.

[Syntax: CFRAMESIDE=color] 
          
Specifies the color to fill the frame area for the row labels that display along the 
left side of a comparative plot.

[Syntax: CFRAMETOP=color] 
          
Specifies the color to fill the frame area for the column labels that display across 
the top of a comparative plot.

[Syntax: CHREF=color] 
          
Specifies the color for horizontal axis reference lines requested by the HREF= option.

[Syntax: CINITIAL=value] 
          
Specifies the initial value for c-hat in the Newton-Raphson approximation of the 
maximum likelihood estimate of c for Weibull distributions requested with the 
WEIBULL or WEIBULL2 option. The default value is 1.8.

[Syntax: COLOR=color] 
          
Specifies the color of the curve or reference line associated with a distribution or 
kernel density estimate. Enclose the COLOR= option in parentheses after a distribution 
option or the KERNEL option. In a HISTOGRAM statement, you can specify a list of colors
in parentheses for multiple density curves.

[Syntax: CONTENTS='string'] 
      
Specifies the table of contents grouping entry for output produced by the plot 
statement. You can specify CONTENTS='' to suppress the grouping entry.

[Syntax: CPROP=color | EMPTY] 
          
Specifies the color for a horizontal bar whose length (relative to the width of the tile) 
indicates the proportion of the total frequency that is represented by the corresponding 
cell in a comparative plot.
