[Syntax: CTEXT=color] 
          
Specifies the color for tick mark values and axis labels. The default is the color 
specified for the CTEXT= option in the GOPTIONS statement.

[Syntax: CTEXTSIDE=color] 
          
Specifies the color for the row labels that display along the left side of a comparative 
plot. By default, the color specified by the CTEXT= option is used. If you omit the CTEXT= 
option, the color specified in the GOPTIONS statement is used.

[Syntax: CTEXTTOP=color] 
          
Specifies the color for the column labels that display along the left side of a comparative 
plot. By default, the color specified by the CTEXT= option is used. If you omit the CTEXT= 
option, the color specified in the GOPTIONS statement is used.

[Syntax: CVREF=color] 
          
Specifies the color for lines requested with the VREF= option.

[Syntax: DESCRIPTION='string'] 
          
Specifies a description, up to 256 characters long, that appears in the PROC GREPLAY 
master menu for a traditional graphics chart. The default value is the analysis variable 
name.

[Syntax: FITINTERVAL=value] 
          
Specifies the value of z for the method of percentiles when this method is used to fit a 
Johnson sB or Johnson sU distribution. The FITINTERVAL= option is specified in parentheses 
after the SB or SU option. The default of z is 0.524.

Specifies the method used to estimate the parameters of a Johnson sB or Johnson sU distribution. 
The FITMETHOD= option is specified in parentheses after the SB or SU option. By default, the 
method of percentiles is used.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Method of percentiles.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Method of MLE.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: FITTOLERANCE=value] 
          
Specifies the tolerance value for the ratio criterion when the method of percentiles 
is used to fit a Johnson sB or Johnson sU distribution. The FITTOLERANCE= option is 
specified in parentheses after the SB or SU option. The default value is 0.01.

[Syntax: FONT=font] 
          
Specifies a software font for reference line and axis labels. You can also specify 
fonts for axis labels in an AXIS statement. The FONT= font takes precedence over the 
FTEXT= font specified in the GOPTIONS statement.

[Syntax: HAXIS=value] 
          
Specifies the name of an AXIS statement describing the horizontal axis.

[Syntax: HEIGHT=value] 
          
Specifies the height, in percentage screen units, of text for axis labels, tick mark 
labels, and legends. This option takes precedence over the HTEXT= option in the GOPTIONS 
statement.

[Syntax: HMINOR=n] 
          
Specifies the number of minor tick marks between each major tick mark on the horizontal 
axis. Minor tick marks are not labeled. By default, HMINOR=0.

[Syntax: HREFLABELS='label1' ...'labeln'] 
          
Specifies labels for the lines requested by the HREF= option. The number of labels 
must equal the number of lines. Enclose each label in quotes. Labels can have up to 
16 characters.
Specifies the vertical position of the HREFLABELS= labels.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Along top of plot
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Staggered from top to bottom of plot
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Staggered from bottom to top of plot

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: INFONT=font] 
          
Specifies a software font to use for text inside the framed areas of the plot. The 
INFONT= option takes precedence over the FTEXT= option in the GOPTIONS statement.

[Syntax: INHEIGHT=value] 
          
Specifies the height, in percentage screen units, of text used inside the framed areas 
of the histogram. By default, the height specified by the HEIGHT= option is used. If you 
do not specify the HEIGHT= option, the height specified with the HTEXT= option in the 
GOPTIONS statement is used.

[Syntax: INTERTILE=value] 
          
Specifies the distance in horizontal percentage screen units between the framed areas, 
called tiles, of a comparative plot. By default, INTERTILE=0.75 percentage screen units. 
This option is not available unless you use the CLASS statement. You can specify INTERTILE=0 
to create contiguous tiles.

[Syntax: L=linetype] 
          
Specifies the line type of the curve or reference line associated with a distribution 
or kernel density estimate. Enclose the L= option in parentheses after the distribution 
option or the KERNEL option. In a HISTOGRAM statement, you can specify a list of line 
types in parentheses for multiple density curves.

[Syntax: linetype] 
          
Specifies the line type for the reference lines that you request with the HREF= option. 
By default, LHREF=2, which produces a dashed line.

[Syntax: LVREF=linetype] 
          
Specifies the line type for lines requested with the VREF= option. By default, LVREF=2, 
which produces a dashed line.

[Syntax: MAXITER=n] 
          
Specifies the maximum number of iterations in the Newton-Raphson approximation of the 
maximum likelihood estimate of α for gamma distributions requested with the GAMMA option 
and c for Weibull distributions requested with the WEIBULL and WEIBULL2 options. Enclose 
the MAXITER= option in parentheses after the GAMMA, WEIBULL, or WEIBULL2 keywords. The 
default value of n is 20.

[Syntax: NAME='string'] 
          
Specifies a name for the plot, up to eight characters long, that appears in the 
PROC GREPLAY master menu for a traditional graphics chart. The default value is 
'UNIVAR'.

[Syntax: NCOLS=n] 
          
Specifies the number of columns per panel in a comparative plot. This option is not 
available unless you use the CLASS statement. By default, NCOLS=1 if you specify only 
one CLASS variable, and NCOLS=2 if you specify two CLASS variables. If you specify two 
CLASS variables, you can use the NCOLS= option with the NROWS= option.
Suppresses the frame around the subplot area.
Suppresses the label for the horizontal axis. You can use this option to reduce clutter.
Suppresses the label for the vertical axis. You can use this option to reduce clutter.

Suppresses the tick marks and tick mark labels for the vertical axis. This option 
also suppresses the label for the vertical axis.

[Syntax: NROWS=n] 
          
Specifies the number of rows per panel in a comparative plot. This option is not 
available unless you use the CLASS statement. By default, NROWS=2. If you specify 
two CLASS variables, you can use the NCOLS= option with the NROWS= option.

Specifies that plots associated with different levels of a CLASS variable be overlaid 
onto a single plot, rather than displayed as separate cells in a comparative plot.

[Syntax: SCALE=value] 
          
Is an alias for the SIGMA= option for distributions requested by the BETA, EXPONENTIAL, 
GAMMA, SB, SU, WEIBULL, and WEIBULL2 options and for the ZETA= option for distributions 
requested by the LOGNORMAL option.

[Syntax: SHAPE=value] 
          
Is an alias for the ALPHA= option for distributions requested by the GAMMA option, 
for the SIGMA= option for distributions requested by the LOGNORMAL option, and for 
the C= option for distributions requested by the WEIBULL and WEIBULL2 options.

Turns the characters in the vertical axis labels so that they display vertically. 
This happens by default when you use a hardware font.

[Syntax: VAXIS=name] 
          
Specifies the name of an AXIS statement describing the vertical axis. In a HISTOGRAM 
statement, you can alternatively specify a value-list for the vertical axis.

[Syntax: VAXISLABEL='label'] 
          
Specifies a label for the vertical axis. Labels can have up to 40 characters.

[Syntax: VMINOR=n] 
          
Specifies the number of minor tick marks between each major tick mark on the vertical 
axis. Minor tick marks are not labeled. The default is zero.

[Syntax: VREF=value-list] 
          
Draws reference lines perpendicular to the vertical axis at the values specified. Also 
see the CVREF= and LVREF= options.

[Syntax: VREFLABELS='label1'...'labeln'] 
          
Specifies labels for the lines requested by the VREF= option. The number of labels 
must equal the number of lines. Enclose each label in quotes. Labels can have up to 
16 characters.
Specifies the horizontal position of the VREFLABELS= labels.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Labels are positioned at the left of the plot.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Labels are positioned at the right of the plot.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: W=value | W=value-list] 
          
Specifies the width in pixels of the curve or reference line associated with a 
distribution or kernel density estimate. Enclose the W= option in parentheses 
after the distribution option or the KERNEL option. In a HISTOGRAM statement, 
you can specify a list of widths in parentheses for multiple density curves.

[Syntax: WAXIS=n] 
          
Specifies the line thickness, in pixels, for the axes and frame.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: INSET keywords-list < / options > ;
      
An INSET statement places a box or table of summary statistics, called an inset, 
directly in a graph created with a CDFPLOT, HISTOGRAM, PPPLOT, PROBPLOT, or QQPLOT 
statement.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: CFILL=color | BLANK] 
          
Specifies the color of the background (including the header background if you do not 
specify the CFILLH= option). CFILL=BLANK leaves the background uncolored and prevents 
items from showing through the inset.
Leaves the background uncolored and prevents items from showing through the inset.

[Syntax: CFILLH=color] 
          
Specifies the color of the header background. The default value is the CFILL= color.

[Syntax: CFRAME=color] 
          
Specifies the color of the frame. The default value is the same color as the 
axis of the plot.

[Syntax: CHEADER=color] 
          
Specifies the color of the header text. The default value is the CTEXT= color.

[Syntax: CSHADOW=color] 
          
Specifies the color of the drop shadow. By default, if a CSHADOW= option is not specified, 
a drop shadow is not displayed.

[Syntax: CTEXT=color] 
          
Specifies the color of the text. By default, the inset text color is the same as the other text 
on the plot.

Specifies that data coordinates are to be used in positioning the inset with the 
POSITION= option.

[Syntax: FONT=font] 
          
Specifies the font of the text. By default, the font is SIMPLEX if the inset is located 
in the interior of the plot, and the font is the same as the other text displayed on the 
plot if the inset is located in the exterior of the plot.

[Syntax: FORMAT=format] 
          
Specifies a format for all the values in the inset.

[Syntax: GUTTER=value] 
          
Specifies the gutter width in percent screen units for an inset located in the top or bottom margin.

[Syntax: HEADER='string'] 
          
Specifies the header text. The string cannot exceed 40 characters. By default, no header line 
appears in the inset.

[Syntax: HEIGHT=value] 
          
Specifies the height of the text.

[Syntax: NCOLS=n] 
          
Specifies the number of columns of (label, value) pairs displayed in an inset 
located in the top or bottom margin.
Suppresses the frame drawn around the text.

[Syntax: POSITION=position] 
          
Determines the position of the inset. The position can be a compass point keyword, 
a margin keyword, or a pair of coordinates (x,y). You can specify coordinates in 
axis percent units or axis data units.

Specifies the reference point for an inset that is positioned by a pair of coordinates 
with the POSITION= option.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Bottom right
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Bottom left (the default)

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: OUTPUT <OUT=SAS-data-set < keyword1=names ...keywordk=names > < percentile-options >> ;
      
The OUTPUT statement saves summary statistics and capability indices in an output data set.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: OUT=SAS-data-set] 
          
Specifies the name of the output data set.

[Syntax: PCTLPTS=percentiles] 
          
Specifies percentiles that are not automatically computed by the procedure.

[Syntax: PCTLPRE=prefixes] 
          
Specifies prefixes used to create variable names for percentiles requested with the PCTLPTS= option.

[Syntax: PCTLNAME=suffixes] 
          
Provides name suffixes for the new variables created by the PCTLPTS= option.
Measures heaviness of tails.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: PPPLOT <variables> < / options> ;
      
The PPPLOT statement creates a probability-probability plot (also referred to as a P-P plot or 
percent plot), which compares the empirical cumulative distribution function (ecdf) of a variable 
with a specified theoretical cumulative distribution function such as the normal.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: ALPHA=value-list] 
          
Specifies the shape parameter α (α > 0) for P-P plots requested with the BETA and GAMMA options.

[Syntax: BETA<(beta-options)>] 
          
Creates a beta P-P plot.
          
You can specify the following beta-options:

  ALPHA=value -- specifies shape parameter, α
  BETA=value -- specifies shape parameter, β 
  SIGMA=value -- specifies scale parameter, σ
  THETA=value -- specifies lower threshold parameter, θ
  COLOR=color -- specifies color of distribution reference line 
  L=linetype -- specifies line type of distribution reference line 
  NOLINE -- suppresses the distribution reference line 
  SYMBOL='character' -- specifies plotting character for line printer plots 
  W= -- specifies width of distribution reference line

[Syntax: BETA=value] 
          
Specifies the shape parameter, β, for P-P plots requested by the BETA option.

[Syntax: C=value] 
          Specifies the shape parameter, c, for P-P plots requested with the WEIBULL option

[Syntax: EXPONENTIAL<(exponential-options)>] 
          
Creates an exponential P-P plot. You can specify the following exponential-options:
          
  SIGMA=value -- specifies scale parameter, σ
  THETA=value -- specifies threshold parameter, θ
  COLOR=color -- specifies color of distribution reference line 
  L=linetype -- specifies line type of distribution reference line 
  NOLINE -- suppresses the distribution reference line 
  SYMBOL='character' -- specifies plotting character for line printer plots 
  W= -- specifies width of distribution reference line

[Syntax: GAMMA<(gamma-options)>] 
          
Creates a gamma P-P plot. You can specify the following gamma-options:
          
  ALPHA=value -- specifies shape parameter, α 
  SIGMA=value -- specifies scale parameter, σ
  THETA=value -- specifies threshold parameter, θ
  COLOR=color -- specifies color of distribution reference line 
  L=linetype -- specifies line type of distribution reference line 
  NOLINE -- suppresses the distribution reference line 
  SYMBOL='character' -- specifies plotting character for line printer plots 
  W= -- specifies width of distribution reference line

[Syntax: LOGNORMAL<(lognormal-options)>] 
          
Creates a lognormal P-P plot. You can specify the following lognormal-options:
          
  SIGMA=value -- specifies shape parameter, σ 
  THETA=value -- specifies threshold parameter, θ 
  ZETA=value -- specifies scale parameter, ζ
  COLOR=color -- specifies color of distribution reference line 
  L=linetype -- specifies line type of distribution reference line 
  NOLINE -- suppresses the distribution reference line 
  SYMBOL='character' -- specifies plotting character for line printer plots 
  W= -- specifies width of distribution reference line

[Syntax: MU=value] 
          
Specifies the parameter, µ,  for normal P-P plot requested with the NORMAL option.
Suppresses the diagonal reference line.
Suppresses the legend that indicates the number of hidden observations.

[Syntax: NORMAL<(normal-options)>] 
          
Creates a normal P-P plot. You can specify the following normal-options:
          
  MU=value -- specifies mean  
  SIGMA=value -- specifies standard deviation
  COLOR=color -- specifies color of distribution reference line 
  L=linetype -- specifies line type of distribution reference line 
  NOLINE -- suppresses the distribution reference line 
  SYMBOL='character' -- specifies plotting character for line printer plots 
  W= -- specifies width of distribution reference line

[Syntax: PPSYMBOL='character'] 
          
Specifies the character used to plot the points in a line printer plot. The default 
is the plus sign (+).

[Syntax: SIGMA=value | EST] 
          
Specifies the scale parameter, σ, for P-P plots requested by the BETA, EXPONENTIAL, GAMMA, LOGNORMAL, 
NORMAL, and WEIBULL options
Displays the P-P plot in a square frame. The default is a rectangular frame.

[Syntax: SYMBOL='character'] 
          
Specifies the character used for the diagonal reference line in line printer plots. 
The default character is the first letter of the distribution option keyword.

[Syntax: THETA=value] 
          
Specifies the lower threshold parameter, θ, for plots requested with the BETA, 
EXPONENTIAL, GAMMA, LOGNORMAL, and WEIBULL options.

[Syntax: WEIBULL<(Weibull-options)>] 
          
Creates a Weibull P-P plot. You can specify the following Weibull-options:
          
  C=value -- specifies shape parameter,c  
  SIGMA=value -- specifies scale parameter, σ 
  THETA=value -- specifies threshold parameter, θ
  COLOR=color -- specifies color of distribution reference line 
  L=linetype -- specifies line type of distribution reference line 
  NOLINE -- suppresses the distribution reference line 
  SYMBOL='character' -- specifies plotting character for line printer plots 
  W= -- specifies width of distribution reference line

[Syntax: ZETA=value] 
          
Specifies a value for the scale parameter, ζ,  for a lognormal P-P plots requested 
with the LOGNORMAL option.

[Syntax: ALPHADELTA=value] 
          
Specifies the change in successive estimates of α-hat at which iteration terminates 
in the Newton-Raphson approximation of the maximum likelihood estimate of α for gamma 
distributions requested with the GAMMA option.

[Syntax: ALPHAINITIAL=value] 
          
Specifies the initial value for α-hat in the Newton-Raphson approximation of the 
maximum likelihood estimate of α for gamma distributions requested with the GAMMA 
option. Enclose the ALPHAINITIAL= option in parentheses after the GAMMA keyword.
Applies the annotation requested with the ANNOTATE= option only to the key cell of a comparative plot.

[Syntax: ANNOTATE=SAS-data-set] 
          
Specifies an input data set that contains annotate variables.

[Syntax: CAXIS=color] 
          
Specifies the color for the axes and tick marks.

[Syntax: CDELTA=value] 
          
Specifies the change in successive estimates of c at which iterations terminate 
in the Newton-Raphson approximation of the maximum likelihood estimate of c for 
Weibull distributions requested by the WEIBULL option. Enclose the CDELTA= option 
in parentheses after the WEIBULL keyword. Iteration continues until the change in  
between consecutive steps is less than the value specified or until the number of 
iterations exceeds the value of the MAXITER= option. The default value is 0.00001.

[Syntax: CFRAME=color] 
          
Specifies the color for the area that is enclosed by the axes and frame. The area 
is not filled by default.

[Syntax: CFRAMESIDE=color] 
          
Specifies the color to fill the frame area for the row labels that display along the 
left side of a comparative plot.

[Syntax: CFRAMETOP=color] 
          
Specifies the color to fill the frame area for the column labels that display across 
the top of a comparative plot.

[Syntax: CHREF=color] 
          
Specifies the color for horizontal axis reference lines requested by the HREF= option.

[Syntax: CINITIAL=value] 
          
Specifies the initial value for c-hat in the Newton-Raphson approximation of the 
maximum likelihood estimate of c for Weibull distributions requested with the 
WEIBULL or WEIBULL2 option. The default value is 1.8.

[Syntax: COLOR=color] 
          
Specifies the color of the curve or reference line associated with a distribution or  
kernel density estimate. Enclose the COLOR= option in parentheses after a distribution 
option or the KERNEL option. In a HISTOGRAM statement, you can specify a list of colors
in parentheses for multiple density curves.

[Syntax: CONTENTS='string'] 
      
Specifies the table of contents grouping entry for output produced by the plot statement. 
You can specify CONTENTS='' to suppress the grouping entry.

[Syntax: CPROP=color | EMPTY] 
          
Specifies the color for a horizontal bar whose length (relative to the width of the tile) 
indicates the proportion of the total frequency that is represented by the corresponding 
cell in a comparative plot.

[Syntax: CTEXT=color] 
          
Specifies the color for tick mark values and axis labels. The default is the color 
specified for the CTEXT= option in the GOPTIONS statement.

[Syntax: CTEXTSIDE=color] 
          
Specifies the color for the row labels that display along the left side of a comparative 
plot. By default, the color specified by the CTEXT= option is used. If you omit the CTEXT= 
option, the color specified in the GOPTIONS statement is used.

[Syntax: CTEXTTOP=color] 
          
Specifies the color for the column labels that display along the left side of a comparative 
plot. By default, the color specified by the CTEXT= option is used. If you omit the CTEXT= 
option, the color specified in the GOPTIONS statement is used.

[Syntax: CVREF=color] 
          
Specifies the color for lines requested with the VREF= option.

[Syntax: DESCRIPTION='string'] 
          
Specifies a description, up to 256 characters long, that appears in the PROC GREPLAY 
master menu for a traditional graphics chart. The default value is the analysis variable 
name.

[Syntax: FITINTERVAL=value] 
          
Specifies the value of z for the method of percentiles when this method is used to 
fit a Johnson sB or Johnson sU distribution. The FITINTERVAL= option is specified 
in parentheses after the SB or SU option. The default of z is 0.524.

Specifies the method used to estimate the parameters of a Johnson sB or Johnson sU distribution. 
The FITMETHOD= option is specified in parentheses after the SB or SU option. By default, the 
method of percentiles is used.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Method of percentiles.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Method of MLE.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: FITTOLERANCE=value] 
          
Specifies the tolerance value for the ratio criterion when the method of percentiles 
is used to fit a Johnson sB or Johnson sU distribution. The FITTOLERANCE= option is 
specified in parentheses after the SB or SU option. The default value is 0.01.

[Syntax: FONT=font] 
          
Specifies a software font for reference line and axis labels. You can also specify 
fonts for axis labels in an AXIS statement. The FONT= font takes precedence over the 
FTEXT= font specified in the GOPTIONS statement.

[Syntax: HAXIS=value] 
          
Specifies the name of an AXIS statement describing the horizontal axis.

[Syntax: HEIGHT=value] 
          
Specifies the height, in percentage screen units, of text for axis labels, tick mark 
labels, and legends. This option takes precedence over the HTEXT= option in the GOPTIONS 
statement.

[Syntax: HMINOR=n] 
          
Specifies the number of minor tick marks between each major tick mark on the horizontal 
axis. Minor tick marks are not labeled. By default, HMINOR=0.

[Syntax: HREFLABELS='label1' ...'labeln'] 
          
Specifies labels for the lines requested by the HREF= option. The number of labels 
must equal the number of lines. Enclose each label in quotes. Labels can have up to 
16 characters.
Specifies the vertical position of the HREFLABELS= labels.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Along top of plot
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Staggered from top to bottom of plot
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Staggered from bottom to top of plot

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: INFONT=font] 
          
Specifies a software font to use for text inside the framed areas of the plot. The 
INFONT= option takes precedence over the FTEXT= option in the GOPTIONS statement.

[Syntax: INHEIGHT=value] 
          
Specifies the height, in percentage screen units, of text used inside the framed areas 
of the histogram. By default, the height specified by the HEIGHT= option is used. If you 
do not specify the HEIGHT= option, the height specified with the HTEXT= option in the 
GOPTIONS statement is used.

[Syntax: INTERTILE=value] 
          
Specifies the distance in horizontal percentage screen units between the framed areas, 
called tiles, of a comparative plot. By default, INTERTILE=0.75 percentage screen units. 
This option is not available unless you use the CLASS statement. You can specify INTERTILE=0 
to create contiguous tiles.

[Syntax: L=linetype] 
          
Specifies the line type of the curve or reference line associated with a distribution or kernel 
density estimate. Enclose the L= option in parentheses after the distribution option or the KERNEL 
option. In a HISTOGRAM statement, you can specify a list of line types in parentheses for multiple 
density curves.

[Syntax: linetype] 
          
Specifies the line type for the reference lines that you request with the HREF= 
option. By default, LHREF=2, which produces a dashed line.

[Syntax: LVREF=linetype] 
          
Specifies the line type for lines requested with the VREF= option. By default, LVREF=2, 
which produces a dashed line.

[Syntax: MAXITER=n] 
          
Specifies the maximum number of iterations in the Newton-Raphson approximation of the 
maximum likelihood estimate of α for gamma distributions requested with the GAMMA option 
and c for Weibull distributions requested with the WEIBULL and WEIBULL2 options. Enclose 
the MAXITER= option in parentheses after the GAMMA, WEIBULL, or WEIBULL2 keywords. The 
default value of n is 20.

[Syntax: NAME='string'] 
          
Specifies a name for the plot, up to eight characters long, that appears in the 
PROC GREPLAY master menu for a traditional graphics chart. The default value is 
'UNIVAR'.

[Syntax: NCOLS=n] 
          
Specifies the number of columns per panel in a comparative plot. This option is not 
available unless you use the CLASS statement. By default, NCOLS=1 if you specify only 
one CLASS variable, and NCOLS=2 if you specify two CLASS variables. If you specify two 
CLASS variables, you can use the NCOLS= option with the NROWS= option.
Suppresses the frame around the subplot area.
Suppresses the label for the horizontal axis. You can use this option to reduce clutter.
Suppresses the label for the vertical axis. You can use this option to reduce clutter.

Suppresses the tick marks and tick mark labels for the vertical axis. This option 
also suppresses the label for the vertical axis.

[Syntax: NROWS=n] 
          
Specifies the number of rows per panel in a comparative plot. This option is not 
available unless you use the CLASS statement. By default, NROWS=2. If you specify 
two CLASS variables, you can use the NCOLS= option with the NROWS= option.

Specifies that plots associated with different levels of a CLASS variable be overlaid 
onto a single plot, rather than displayed as separate cells in a comparative plot.

[Syntax: SCALE=value] 
          
Is an alias for the SIGMA= option for distributions requested by the BETA, EXPONENTIAL, 
GAMMA, SB, SU, WEIBULL, and WEIBULL2 options and for the ZETA= option for distributions 
requested by the LOGNORMAL option.

[Syntax: SHAPE=value] 
          
Is an alias for the ALPHA= option for distributions requested by the GAMMA option, 
for the SIGMA= option for distributions requested by the LOGNORMAL option, and for 
the C= option for distributions requested by the WEIBULL and WEIBULL2 options.

Turns the characters in the vertical axis labels so that they display vertically. 
This happens by default when you use a hardware font.

[Syntax: VAXIS=name] 
          
Specifies the name of an AXIS statement describing the vertical axis. In a HISTOGRAM 
statement, you can alternatively specify a value-list for the vertical axis.

[Syntax: VAXISLABEL='label'] 
          
Specifies a label for the vertical axis. Labels can have up to 40 characters.

[Syntax: VMINOR=n] 
          
Specifies the number of minor tick marks between each major tick mark on the vertical 
axis. Minor tick marks are not labeled. The default is zero.

[Syntax: VREF=value-list] 
          
Draws reference lines perpendicular to the vertical axis at the values specified. Also 
see the CVREF= and LVREF= options.

[Syntax: VREFLABELS='label1'...'labeln'] 
          
Specifies labels for the lines requested by the VREF= option. The number of labels 
must equal the number of lines. Enclose each label in quotes. Labels can have up to 
16 characters.
Specifies the horizontal position of the VREFLABELS= labels.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Labels are positioned at the left of the plot.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Labels are positioned at the right of the plot.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: W=value | W=value-list] 
          
Specifies the width in pixels of the curve or reference line associated with 
a distribution or kernel density estimate. Enclose the W= option in parentheses 
after the distribution option or the KERNEL option. In a HISTOGRAM statement, 
you can specify a list of widths in parentheses for multiple density curves.

[Syntax: WAXIS=n] 
          
Specifies the line thickness, in pixels, for the axes and frame.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: PROBPLOT <variables> < / options> ; 
      
The PROBPLOT statement creates a probability plot, which compares ordered variable values 
with the percentiles of a specified theoretical distribution. If the data distribution 
matches the theoretical distribution, the points on the plot form a linear pattern.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: ALPHA=value-list | EST] 
          
Specifies values for a mandatory shape parameter α (α > 0) for probability plots requested with the 
BETA and GAMMA options.

[Syntax: BETA(ALPHA=value | EST  BETA=value | EST <beta-options>)] 
          
Creates a beta probability plot for each combination of the required shape parameters, α and β, 
specified by the required ALPHA= and BETA= beta-options. You can specify the following beta-options:

  ALPHA=value-list|EST -- specifies mandatory shape parameter, α
  BETA=value-list|EST -- specifies mandatory shape parameter, β  
  SIGMA=value|EST -- specifies σ0 for distribution reference line 
  THETA=value|EST -- specifies θ0 for distribution reference line
  COLOR=color -- specifies color of distribution reference line 
  L=linetype -- specifies line type of distribution reference line 
  SYMBOL='character' -- specifies plotting character for line printer plots 
  W= -- specifies width of distribution reference line)>

[Syntax: BETA=value|EST] 
          
Specifies values for the shape parameter β for probability plots requested with the BETA option.

[Syntax: C=value-list|EST] 
          
Specifies the shape parameter, c, for probability plots requested with the WEIBULL and WEIBULL2 options.

[Syntax: EXPONENTIAL<(exponential-options )>] 
          
Creates an exponential probability plot. Available exponential-options are:
          
  SIGMA=value|EST -- specifies σ0 for distribution reference line 
  THETA=value|EST -- specifies θ0 for distribution reference line 
  COLOR=color -- specifies color of distribution reference line 
  L=linetype -- specifies line type of distribution reference line 
  SYMBOL='character' -- specifies plotting character for line printer plots 
  W= -- specifies width of distribution reference line

[Syntax: GAMMA(ALPHA=value | EST <gamma-options>)] 
          
Creates a gamma probability plot for each value of the shape parameter α given by the mandatory 
ALPHA= gamma-option.
          
Available gamma-options are:

  ALPHA=value-list|EST -- specifies mandatory shape parameter, α  
  SIGMA=value|EST -- specifies σ0 for distribution reference line 
  THETA=value|EST -- specifies θ0 for distribution reference line
  COLOR=color -- specifies color of distribution reference line 
  L=linetype -- specifies line type of distribution reference line 
  SYMBOL='character' -- specifies plotting character for line printer plots 
  W= -- specifies width of distribution reference line
Draws reference lines perpendicular to the percentile axis at major tick marks.

[Syntax: GRIDCHAR='character'] 
          
Specifies the character used for the lines requested by the GRID option for a line printer plot. 
The default is the vertical bar (|).

[Syntax: LEGEND=name | NONE] 
          
Specifies the name of a LEGEND statement describing the legend for specification limit reference
lines and fitted curves. Specifying LEGEND=NONE is equivalent to specifying the NOLEGEND option.

[Syntax: LGRID=linetype] 
          
Specifies the line type for the reference lines requested by the GRID= option. By default, LGRID=1, 
which produces a solid line.

[Syntax: LOGNORMAL(SIGMA=value | EST <lognormal-options>)] 
          
Creates a lognormal probability plot for each value of the shape parameter σ given by the mandatory 
SIGMA= option.

Available lognormal-options are:

  SIGMA=value-list|EST -- specifies mandatory shape parameter, σ 
  SLOPE=value|EST -- specifies slope of distribution reference line 
  THETA=value|EST -- specifies θ0 for distribution reference line 
  ZETA=value|EST -- specifies ζ0 for distribution reference line
  COLOR=color -- specifies color of distribution reference line 
  L=linetype -- specifies line type of distribution reference line 
  SYMBOL='character' -- specifies plotting character for line printer plots 
  W= -- specifies width of distribution reference line

[Syntax: MU=value|EST] 
          
Specifies the mean, µ,  for a normal probability plot requested with the NORMAL option.

[Syntax: NADJ=value] 
          
Specifies the adjustment value added to the sample size in the calculation of theoretical percentiles. 
The default is 1/4, as recommended by Blom (1958).
Suppresses legends for specification limits, fitted curves, distribution lines, and hidden observations.
Suppresses the legend for the optional distribution reference line.
Suppresses the legend that indicates the number of hidden observations.

[Syntax: NORMAL<(normal-options)>] '
          
Creates a normal probability plot. Available normal-options are:
          
  MU=value|EST -- specifies u0 for distribution reference line 
  SIGMA=value|EST -- specifies σ0 for distribution reference line 
  COLOR=color -- specifies color of distribution reference line 
  L=linetype -- specifies line type of distribution reference line 
  SYMBOL='character' -- specifies plotting character for line printer plots 
  W= -- specifies width of distribution reference line
Suppresses the legend for specification limit reference lines.
Requests minor tick marks for the percentile axis.

[Syntax: PCTLORDER=value-list] 
          
Specifies the tick mark values labeled on the theoretical percentile axis.

[Syntax: PROBSYMBOL='character'] 
          
Specifies the character used to mark the points in a line printer plot. The default is the 
plus sign (+).

[Syntax: RANKADJ=value] 
          
Specifies the adjustment value added to the ranks in the calculation of theoretical percentiles.

Switches the horizontal and vertical axes so that the theoretical percentiles are plotted vertically 
while the data are plotted horizontally.

[Syntax: SIGMA=value | EST] 
          
Specifies the value of the parameter σ, where σ > 0. Alternatively, you can specify SIGMA=EST to 
request a maximum likelihood estimate for σ0.

[Syntax: SLOPE=value | EST] 
          
Specifies the slope for a distribution reference line requested with the LOGNORMAL and WEIBULL2 options.
Displays the probability plot in a square frame. The default is a rectangular frame.

[Syntax: SYMBOL='character'] 
          
Specifies the character used to display the distribution reference line in a 
line printer plot.

[Syntax: THETA=value | EST] 
          
Specifies the lower threshold parameter, θ, for plots requested with the BETA, EXPONENTIAL, GAMMA, 
LOGNORMAL, WEIBULL and WEIBULL2 options.

[Syntax: WEIBULL(C=value | EST <Weibull-options>)] 
          
Creates a three-parameter Weibull probability plot for each value of the required 
shape parameter, c, specified by the mandatory C= Weibull-option.

Available Weibull-options are:

  C=value-list|EST -- specifies mandatory shape parameter c 
  SIGMA=value|EST -- specifies σ0 for distribution reference line 
  THETA=value|EST -- specifies θ0 for distribution reference line 
  COLOR=color -- specifies color of distribution reference line 
  L=linetype -- specifies line type of distribution reference line 
  SYMBOL='character' -- specifies plotting character for line printer plots 
  W= -- specifies width of distribution reference line

[Syntax: WEIBULL2<(Weibull2-options)>] 
          
Creates a two-parameter Weibull probability plot.
          
You should use the WEIBULL2 option when your data have a known lower threshold, θ0.
          
Available Weibull2-options are:

  C=value|EST  -- specifies c0 for distribution reference line (slope is 1/c0)
  SIGMA=value|EST -- specifies σ0 for distribution reference line 
  SLOPE=value|EST -- specifies slope of distribution reference line 
  THETA=value -- specifies known lower threshold θ0
  COLOR=color -- specifies color of distribution reference line 
  L=linetype -- specifies line type of distribution reference line 
  SYMBOL='character' -- specifies plotting character for line printer plots 
  W= -- specifies width of distribution reference line

[Syntax: ZETA=value | EST] 
          
Specifies a value for the scale parameter, ζ, for lognormal probability plots requested with the 
LOGNORMAL option.

[Syntax: ALPHADELTA=value] 
          
Specifies the change in successive estimates of α-hat at which iteration terminates in the 
Newton-Raphson approximation of the maximum likelihood estimate of α for gamma distributions 
requested with the GAMMA option.

[Syntax: ALPHAINITIAL=value] 
          
Specifies the initial value for α-hat in the Newton-Raphson approximation of the 
maximum likelihood estimate of α for gamma distributions requested with the GAMMA 
option. Enclose the ALPHAINITIAL= option in parentheses after the GAMMA keyword.

Applies the annotation requested with the ANNOTATE= option only to the key cell 
of a comparative plot.

[Syntax: ANNOTATE=SAS-data-set] 
          
Specifies an input data set that contains annotate variables.

[Syntax: CAXIS=color] 
          
Specifies the color for the axes and tick marks.

[Syntax: CDELTA=value] 
          
Specifies the change in successive estimates of c at which iterations terminate in 
the Newton-Raphson approximation of the maximum likelihood estimate of c for Weibull 
distributions requested by the WEIBULL option. Enclose the CDELTA= option in parentheses 
after the WEIBULL keyword. Iteration continues until the change in c between consecutive 
steps is less than the value specified or until the number of iterations exceeds the 
value of the MAXITER= option. The default value is 0.00001.

[Syntax: CFRAME=color] 
          
Specifies the color for the area that is enclosed by the axes and frame. The area 
is not filled by default.

[Syntax: CFRAMESIDE=color] 
          
Specifies the color to fill the frame area for the row labels that display along the 
left side of a comparative plot.

[Syntax: CFRAMETOP=color] 
          
Specifies the color to fill the frame area for the column labels that display across 
the top of a comparative plot.

[Syntax: CHREF=color] 
          
Specifies the color for horizontal axis reference lines requested by the HREF= option.

[Syntax: CINITIAL=value] 
          
Specifies the initial value for c-hat in the Newton-Raphson approximation of the 
maximum likelihood estimate of c for Weibull distributions requested with the WEIBULL 
or WEIBULL2 option. The default value is 1.8.

[Syntax: COLOR=color] 
          
Specifies the color of the curve or reference line associated with a distribution or  
kernel density estimate. Enclose the COLOR= option in parentheses after a distribution 
option or the KERNEL option. In a HISTOGRAM statement, you can specify a list of colors
in parentheses for multiple density curves.

[Syntax: CONTENTS='string'] 
      
Specifies the table of contents grouping entry for output produced by the plot 
statement. You can specify CONTENTS='' to suppress the grouping entry.

[Syntax: CPROP=color | EMPTY] 
          
Specifies the color for a horizontal bar whose length (relative to the width of the tile) 
indicates the proportion of the total frequency that is represented by the corresponding 
cell in a comparative plot.

[Syntax: CTEXT=color] 
          
Specifies the color for tick mark values and axis labels. The default is the color 
specified for the CTEXT= option in the GOPTIONS statement.

[Syntax: CTEXTSIDE=color] 
          
Specifies the color for the row labels that display along the left side of a comparative 
plot. By default, the color specified by the CTEXT= option is used. If you omit the CTEXT= 
option, the color specified in the GOPTIONS statement is used.

[Syntax: CTEXTTOP=color] 
          
Specifies the color for the column labels that display along the left side of a 
comparative plot. By default, the color specified by the CTEXT= option is used. 
If you omit the CTEXT= option, the color specified in the GOPTIONS statement is 
used.

[Syntax: CVREF=color] 
          
Specifies the color for lines requested with the VREF= option.

[Syntax: DESCRIPTION='string'] 
          
Specifies a description, up to 256 characters long, that appears in the PROC GREPLAY 
master menu for a traditional graphics chart. The default value is the analysis variable 
name.

[Syntax: FITINTERVAL=value] 
          
Specifies the value of z for the method of percentiles when this method is used to 
fit a Johnson sB or Johnson sU distribution. The FITINTERVAL= option is specified 
in parentheses after the SB or SU option. The default of z is 0.524.

Specifies the method used to estimate the parameters of a Johnson sB or Johnson sU 
distribution. The FITMETHOD= option is specified in parentheses after the SB or 
SU option. By default, the method of percentiles is used.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Method of percentiles.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Method of MLE.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: FITTOLERANCE=value] 
          
Specifies the tolerance value for the ratio criterion when the method of percentiles 
is used to fit a Johnson sB or Johnson sU distribution. The FITTOLERANCE= option is 
specified in parentheses after the SB or SU option. The default value is 0.01.

[Syntax: FONT=font] 
          
Specifies a software font for reference line and axis labels. You can also specify 
fonts for axis labels in an AXIS statement. The FONT= font takes precedence over the 
FTEXT= font specified in the GOPTIONS statement.

[Syntax: HAXIS=value] 
          
Specifies the name of an AXIS statement describing the horizontal axis.

[Syntax: HEIGHT=value] 
          
Specifies the height, in percentage screen units, of text for axis labels, tick mark 
labels, and legends. This option takes precedence over the HTEXT= option in the GOPTIONS 
statement.

[Syntax: HMINOR=n] 
          
Specifies the number of minor tick marks between each major tick mark on the horizontal 
axis. Minor tick marks are not labeled. By default, HMINOR=0.

[Syntax: HREFLABELS='label1' ...'labeln'] 
          
Specifies labels for the lines requested by the HREF= option. The number of labels 
must equal the number of lines. Enclose each label in quotes. Labels can have up to 
16 characters.
Specifies the vertical position of the HREFLABELS= labels.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Along top of plot
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Staggered from top to bottom of plot
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Staggered from bottom to top of plot

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: INFONT=font] 
          
Specifies a software font to use for text inside the framed areas of the plot. The 
INFONT= option takes precedence over the FTEXT= option in the GOPTIONS statement.

[Syntax: INHEIGHT=value] 
          
Specifies the height, in percentage screen units, of text used inside the framed 
areas of the histogram. By default, the height specified by the HEIGHT= option is 
used. If you do not specify the HEIGHT= option, the height specified with the HTEXT=
option in the GOPTIONS statement is used.

[Syntax: INTERTILE=value] 
          
Specifies the distance in horizontal percentage screen units between the framed areas, 
called tiles, of a comparative plot. By default, INTERTILE=0.75 percentage screen units. 
This option is not available unless you use the CLASS statement. You can specify INTERTILE=0 
to create contiguous tiles.

[Syntax: L=linetype] 
          
Specifies the line type of the curve or reference line associated with a distribution 
or kernel density estimate. Enclose the L= option in parentheses after the distribution 
option or the KERNEL option. In a HISTOGRAM statement, you can specify a list of line 
types in parentheses for multiple density curves.

[Syntax: linetype] 
          
Specifies the line type for the reference lines that you request with the HREF= option. 
By default, LHREF=2, which produces a dashed line.

[Syntax: LVREF=linetype] 
          
Specifies the line type for lines requested with the VREF= option. By default, LVREF=2, 
which produces a dashed line.

[Syntax: MAXITER=n] 
          
Specifies the maximum number of iterations in the Newton-Raphson approximation of the 
maximum likelihood estimate of α for gamma distributions requested with the GAMMA option 
and c for Weibull distributions requested with the WEIBULL and WEIBULL2 options. Enclose 
the MAXITER= option in parentheses after the GAMMA, WEIBULL, or WEIBULL2 keywords. The 
default value of n is 20.

[Syntax: NAME='string'] 
          
Specifies a name for the plot, up to eight characters long, that appears in the 
PROC GREPLAY master menu for a traditional graphics chart. The default value is 
'UNIVAR'.

[Syntax: NCOLS=n] 
          
Specifies the number of columns per panel in a comparative plot. This option is not 
available unless you use the CLASS statement. By default, NCOLS=1 if you specify only 
one CLASS variable, and NCOLS=2 if you specify two CLASS variables. If you specify two 
CLASS variables, you can use the NCOLS= option with the NROWS= option.
Suppresses the frame around the subplot area.
Suppresses the label for the horizontal axis. You can use this option to reduce clutter.
Suppresses the label for the vertical axis. You can use this option to reduce clutter.

Suppresses the tick marks and tick mark labels for the vertical axis. This option 
also suppresses the label for the vertical axis.

[Syntax: NROWS=n] 
          
Specifies the number of rows per panel in a comparative plot. This option is not 
available unless you use the CLASS statement. By default, NROWS=2. If you specify 
two CLASS variables, you can use the NCOLS= option with the NROWS= option.

Specifies that plots associated with different levels of a CLASS variable be overlaid 
onto a single plot, rather than displayed as separate cells in a comparative plot.

[Syntax: SCALE=value] 
          
Is an alias for the SIGMA= option for distributions requested by the BETA, EXPONENTIAL, 
GAMMA, SB, SU, WEIBULL, and WEIBULL2 options and for the ZETA= option for distributions 
requested by the LOGNORMAL option.

[Syntax: SHAPE=value] 
          
Is an alias for the ALPHA= option for distributions requested by the GAMMA option, 
for the SIGMA= option for distributions requested by the LOGNORMAL option, and for 
the C= option for distributions requested by the WEIBULL and WEIBULL2 options.

Turns the characters in the vertical axis labels so that they display vertically. 
This happens by default when you use a hardware font.

[Syntax: VAXIS=name] 
          
Specifies the name of an AXIS statement describing the vertical axis. In a HISTOGRAM 
statement, you can alternatively specify a value-list for the vertical axis.

[Syntax: VAXISLABEL='label'] 
          
Specifies a label for the vertical axis. Labels can have up to 40 characters.

[Syntax: VMINOR=n] 
          
Specifies the number of minor tick marks between each major tick mark on the vertical 
axis. Minor tick marks are not labeled. The default is zero.

[Syntax: VREF=value-list] 
          
Draws reference lines perpendicular to the vertical axis at the values specified. 
Also see the CVREF= and LVREF= options.

[Syntax: VREFLABELS='label1'...'labeln'] 
          
Specifies labels for the lines requested by the VREF= option. The number of labels 
must equal the number of lines. Enclose each label in quotes. Labels can have up to 
16 characters.
Specifies the horizontal position of the VREFLABELS= labels.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Labels are positioned at the left of the plot.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Labels are positioned at the right of the plot.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: W=value | W=value-list] 
          
Specifies the width in pixels of the curve or reference line associated with a distribution 
or kernel density estimate. Enclose the W= option in parentheses after the distribution option 
or the KERNEL option. In a HISTOGRAM statement, you can specify a list of widths in parentheses 
for multiple density curves.

[Syntax: WAXIS=n] 
          
Specifies the line thickness, in pixels, for the axes and frame.

[Syntax: ALPHA=value-list | EST] 
          
Specifies values for a mandatory shape parameter α (α > 0) for Q-Q plots requested 
with the BETA and GAMMA options.

[Syntax: BETA(ALPHA=value | EST  BETA=value | EST <beta-options>)] 
          
Creates a beta Q-Q plot for each combination of the required shape parameters, α and β, 
specified by the required ALPHA= and BETA= beta-options. You can specify the following 
beta-options:

  ALPHA=value-list|EST -- specifies mandatory shape parameter, α
  BETA=value-list|EST -- specifies mandatory shape parameter, β  
  SIGMA=value|EST -- specifies σ0 for distribution reference line 
  THETA=value|EST -- specifies θ0 for distribution reference line
  COLOR=color -- specifies color of distribution reference line 
  L=linetype -- specifies line type of distribution reference line 
  SYMBOL='character' -- specifies plotting character for line printer plots 
  W= -- specifies width of distribution reference line)>

[Syntax: BETA=value|EST] 
          
Specifies values for the shape parameter, β, for Q-Q plots requested with the 
BETA option.

[Syntax: C=value-list|EST] 
          
Specifies the shape parameter, c, for Q-Q plots requested with the WEIBULL and 
WEIBULL2 options.

Draws reference lines extending from the intersections of the specification limits 
with the distribution reference line to the quantile axis in plots requested with 
the NORMAL option.
Rescales the quantile axis in Cpk units for plots requested with the NORMAL option.

[Syntax: EXPONENTIAL<(exponential-options )>] 
          
Creates an exponential Q-Q plot. Available exponential-options are:
          
  SIGMA=value|EST -- specifies σ0 for distribution reference line 
  THETA=value|EST -- specifies θ0 for distribution reference line 
  COLOR=color -- specifies color of distribution reference line 
  L=linetype -- specifies line type of distribution reference line 
  SYMBOL='character' -- specifies plotting character for line printer plots 
  W= -- specifies width of distribution reference line

[Syntax: GAMMA(ALPHA=value | EST <gamma-options>)] 
          
Creates a gamma Q-Q plot for each value of the shape parameter α given by the 
mandatory ALPHA= gamma-option.
          
Available gamma-options are:

  ALPHA=value-list|EST -- specifies mandatory shape parameter, α  
  SIGMA=value|EST -- specifies σ0 for distribution reference line 
  THETA=value|EST -- specifies θ0 for distribution reference line
  COLOR=color -- specifies color of distribution reference line 
  L=linetype -- specifies line type of distribution reference line 
  SYMBOL='character' -- specifies plotting character for line printer plots 
  W= -- specifies width of distribution reference line

[Syntax: LEGEND=name | NONE] 
          
Specifies the name of a LEGEND statement describing the legend for specification limit reference 
lines and fitted curves. Specifying LEGEND=NONE is equivalent to specifying the NOLEGEND option.

[Syntax: LOGNORMAL(SIGMA=value | EST <lognormal-options>)] 
          
Creates a lognormal Q-Q plot for each value of the shape parameter, σ, given by the 
mandatory SIGMA= option. Available lognormal-options are:

  SIGMA=value-list|EST -- specifies mandatory shape parameter, σ 
  SLOPE=value|EST -- specifies slope of distribution reference line 
  THETA=value|EST -- specifies θ0 for distribution reference line 
  ZETA=value|EST -- specifies ζ0 for distribution reference line
  COLOR=color -- specifies color of distribution reference line 
  L=linetype -- specifies line type of distribution reference line 
  SYMBOL='character' -- specifies plotting character for line printer plots 
  W= -- specifies width of distribution reference line

[Syntax: MU=value|EST] 
          
Specifies the mean, µ,  for a normal Q-Q plot requested with the NORMAL option.

[Syntax: NADJ=value] 
          
Specifies the adjustment value added to the sample size in the calculation of theoretical percentiles. 
The default is 1/4, as recommended by Blom (1958).

Suppresses legends for specification limits, fitted curves, distribution lines, and hidden 
observations.
Suppresses the legend for the optional distribution reference line.
Suppresses the legend that indicates the number of hidden observations.

[Syntax: NORMAL<(normal-options)>] 
          
Creates a normal Q-Q plot. Available normal-options are:
          
  MU=value|EST -- specifies u0 for distribution reference line 
  SIGMA=value|EST -- specifies σ0 for distribution reference line 
  COLOR=color -- specifies color of distribution reference line 
  L=linetype -- specifies line type of distribution reference line 
  SYMBOL='character' -- specifies plotting character for line printer plots 
  W= -- specifies width of distribution reference line
Suppresses the legend for specification limit reference lines.

[Syntax: PCTLAXIS(axis-options)] 
          
Adds a nonlinear percentile axis along the frame of the Q-Q plot opposite the theoretical quantile axis.
          
You can specify the following axis-options: 

  GRID -- draws vertical grid lines at major percentiles 
  GRIDCHAR='character'  specifies grid line character for line printer plots 
  LABEL='string' -- specifies label for percentile axis 
  LGRID=linetype -- specifies line type for grid
Requests minor tick marks for the percentile axis.

[Syntax: PCTLORDER=value-list] 
          
Requests scale labels for the theoretical quantile axis in percentile units, resulting in a nonlinear 
axis scale.

[Syntax: PROBSYMBOL='character'] 
          
Specifies the character used to mark the points in a line printer plot. The default is the plus sign (+).

[Syntax: RANKADJ=value] 
          
Specifies the adjustment value added to the ranks in the calculation of theoretical percentiles.

Switches the horizontal and vertical axes so that the theoretical percentiles are plotted vertically 
while the data are plotted horizontally.

[Syntax: SIGMA=value | EST] 
          
Specifies the value of the distribution parameter σ, where σ > 0. Alternatively, 
you can specify SIGMA=EST to request a maximum likelihood estimate for σ0.

[Syntax: SLOPE=value | EST] 
          
Specifies the slope for a distribution reference line requested with the LOGNORMAL 
and WEIBULL2 options.
Displays the Q-Q plot in a square frame. The default is a rectangular frame.

[Syntax: SYMBOL='character'] 
          
Specifies the character used to display the distribution reference line in a line 
printer plot.

[Syntax: THETA=value | EST] 
          
Specifies the lower threshold parameter, θ, for Q-Q plots requested with the BETA, 
EXPONENTIAL, GAMMA, LOGNORMAL, WEIBULL and WEIBULL2 options.

[Syntax: WEIBULL(C=value | EST <Weibull-options>)] 
          
Creates a three-parameter Weibull Q-Q plot for each value of the required shape 
parameter, c, specified by the mandatory C= option.

Available Weibull-options are:

  C=value-list|EST -- specifies mandatory shape parameter c 
  SIGMA=value|EST -- specifies σ0 for distribution reference line 
  THETA=value|EST -- specifies θ0 for distribution reference line 
  COLOR=color -- specifies color of distribution reference line 
  L=linetype -- specifies line type of distribution reference line 
  SYMBOL='character' -- specifies plotting character for line printer plots 
  W=  -- specifies width of distribution reference line

[Syntax: WEIBULL2<(Weibull2-options)>] 
          
Creates a two-parameter Weibull Q-Q plot. You should use the WEIBULL2 option when your data have 
a known lower threshold, θ0.
          
Available Weibull2-options are:

  C=value|EST -- specifies c0 for distribution reference line (slope is 1/c0)
  SIGMA=value|EST -- specifies σ0 for distribution reference line 
  SLOPE=value|EST -- specifies slope of distribution reference line 
  THETA=value -- specifies known lower threshold θ0
  COLOR=color -- specifies color of distribution reference line 
  L=linetype -- specifies line type of distribution reference line 
  SYMBOL='character' -- specifies plotting character for line printer plots 
  W= -- specifies width of distribution reference line

[Syntax: ZETA=value | EST] 
          
Specifies a value for the scale parameter, ζ, for lognormal Q-Q plots requested with the 
LOGNORMAL option.

[Syntax: ALPHADELTA=value] 
          
Specifies the change in successive estimates of α-hat at which iteration terminates 
in the Newton-Raphson approximation of the maximum likelihood estimate of α for gamma 
distributions requested with the GAMMA option.

[Syntax: ALPHAINITIAL=value] 
          
Specifies the initial value for α-hat in the Newton-Raphson approximation of the maximum 
likelihood estimate of α for gamma distributions requested with the GAMMA option. Enclose 
the ALPHAINITIAL= option in parentheses after the GAMMA keyword.
Applies the annotation requested with the ANNOTATE= option only to the key cell of a comparative plot.

[Syntax: ANNOTATE=SAS-data-set] 
          
Specifies an input data set that contains annotate variables.

[Syntax: CAXIS=color] 
          
Specifies the color for the axes and tick marks.

[Syntax: CDELTA=value] 
          
Specifies the change in successive estimates of c at which iterations terminate in 
the Newton-Raphson approximation of the maximum likelihood estimate of c for Weibull 
distributions requested by the WEIBULL option. Enclose the CDELTA= option in parentheses 
after the WEIBULL keyword. Iteration continues until the change in c between consecutive 
steps is less than the value specified or until the number of iterations exceeds the 
value of the MAXITER= option. The default value is 0.00001.

[Syntax: CFRAME=color] 
          
Specifies the color for the area that is enclosed by the axes and frame. The area 
is not filled by default.

[Syntax: CFRAMESIDE=color] 
          
Specifies the color to fill the frame area for the row labels that display along the 
left side of a comparative plot.

[Syntax: CFRAMETOP=color] 
          
Specifies the color to fill the frame area for the column labels that display across 
the top of a comparative plot.

[Syntax: CHREF=color] 
          
Specifies the color for horizontal axis reference lines requested by the HREF= option.

[Syntax: CINITIAL=value] 
          
Specifies the initial value for c-hat in the Newton-Raphson approximation of the maximum 
likelihood estimate of c for Weibull distributions requested with the WEIBULL or WEIBULL2 
option. The default value is 1.8.

[Syntax: COLOR=color] 
          
Specifies the color of the curve or reference line associated with a distribution or 
kernel density estimate. Enclose the COLOR= option in parentheses after a distribution 
option or the KERNEL option. In a HISTOGRAM statement, you can specify a list of colors
in parentheses for multiple density curves.

[Syntax: CONTENTS='string'] 
      
Specifies the table of contents grouping entry for output produced by the plot statement. 
You can specify CONTENTS='' to suppress the grouping entry.

[Syntax: CPROP=color | EMPTY] 
          
Specifies the color for a horizontal bar whose length (relative to the width of the tile) 
indicates the proportion of the total frequency that is represented by the corresponding 
cell in a comparative plot.

[Syntax: CTEXT=color] 
          
Specifies the color for tick mark values and axis labels. The default is the color 
specified for the CTEXT= option in the GOPTIONS statement.

[Syntax: CTEXTSIDE=color] 
          
Specifies the color for the row labels that display along the left side of a comparative 
plot. By default, the color specified by the CTEXT= option is used. If you omit the CTEXT= 
option, the color specified in the GOPTIONS statement is used.

[Syntax: CTEXTTOP=color] 
          
Specifies the color for the column labels that display along the left side of a 
comparative plot. By default, the color specified by the CTEXT= option is used. 
If you omit the CTEXT= option, the color specified in the GOPTIONS statement is 
used.

[Syntax: CVREF=color] 
          
Specifies the color for lines requested with the VREF= option.

[Syntax: DESCRIPTION='string'] 
          
Specifies a description, up to 256 characters long, that appears in the PROC GREPLAY 
master menu for a traditional graphics chart. The default value is the analysis variable 
name.

[Syntax: FITINTERVAL=value] 
          
Specifies the value of z for the method of percentiles when this method is used to 
fit a Johnson sB or Johnson sU distribution. The FITINTERVAL= option is specified 
in parentheses after the SB or SU option. The default of z is 0.524.

Specifies the method used to estimate the parameters of a Johnson sB or Johnson sU 
distribution. The FITMETHOD= option is specified in parentheses after the SB or 
SU option. By default, the method of percentiles is used.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Method of percentiles.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Method of MLE.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: FITTOLERANCE=value] 
          
Specifies the tolerance value for the ratio criterion when the method of percentiles 
is used to fit a Johnson sB or Johnson sU distribution. The FITTOLERANCE= option is 
specified in parentheses after the SB or SU option. The default value is 0.01.

[Syntax: FONT=font] 
          
Specifies a software font for reference line and axis labels. You can also specify 
fonts for axis labels in an AXIS statement. The FONT= font takes precedence over the 
FTEXT= font specified in the GOPTIONS statement.

[Syntax: HAXIS=value]

[Syntax: HEIGHT=value] 
          
Specifies the height, in percentage screen units, of text for axis labels, tick mark 
labels, and legends. This option takes precedence over the HTEXT= option in the GOPTIONS 
statement.

[Syntax: HMINOR=n] 
          
Specifies the number of minor tick marks between each major tick mark on the horizontal

[Syntax: HREFLABELS='label1' ...'labeln'] 
          
Specifies labels for the lines requested by the HREF= option. The number of labels 
must equal the number of lines. Enclose each label in quotes. Labels can have up to 
16 characters.
Specifies the vertical position of the HREFLABELS= labels.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Along top of plot
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Staggered from top to bottom of plot
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Staggered from bottom to top of plot

[Syntax: INHEIGHT=value] 
          
Specifies the height, in percentage screen units, of text used inside the framed areas 
of the histogram. By default, the height specified by the HEIGHT= option is used. If you 
do not specify the HEIGHT= option, the height specified with the HTEXT= option in the 
GOPTIONS statement is used.

[Syntax: INTERTILE=value] 
          
Specifies the distance in horizontal percentage screen units between the framed areas, 
called tiles, of a comparative plot. By default, INTERTILE=0.75 percentage screen units. 
This option is not available unless you use the CLASS statement. You can specify INTERTILE=0 
to create contiguous tiles.

[Syntax: L=linetype]

or kernel density estimate. Enclose the L= option in parentheses after the distribution

[Syntax: linetype]

By default, LHREF=2, which produces a dashed line.

[Syntax: LVREF=linetype] 
          
Specifies the line type for lines requested with the VREF= option. By default, LVREF=2,

Suppresses the frame around the subplot area.
Suppresses the label for the horizontal axis. You can use this option to reduce clutter.
Suppresses the label for the vertical axis. You can use this option to reduce clutter.

Suppresses the tick marks and tick mark labels for the vertical axis. This option also

[Syntax: NROWS=n]

Turns the characters in the vertical axis labels so that they display vertically. 
This happens by default when you use a hardware font.

[Syntax: VAXISLABEL='label'] 
          
Specifies a label for the vertical axis. Labels can have up to 40 characters.

tick marks are not labeled. The default is zero.

Specifies the horizontal position of the VREFLABELS= labels.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Labels are positioned at the right of the plot.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: W=value | W=value-list] 
          
Specifies the width in pixels of the curve or reference line associated with a distribution or kernel 
density estimate. Enclose the W= option in parentheses after the distribution option or the KERNEL option. 
In a HISTOGRAM statement, you can specify a list of widths in parentheses for multiple density curves.

[Syntax: WAXIS=n] 
          
Specifies the line thickness, in pixels, for the axes and frame.

[Syntax: ALPHA=value-list] 
          
Specifies values of α, the probability or confidence associated with the interval.

[Syntax: K=value-list] 
          
Lists values of k for prediction intervals. Default values of 1, 2, and 3 are used for 
the prediction interval for k future observations and for the prediction interval for 
the mean of k future observations.
Specifies which intervals are computed. The indices can range from 1 to 6.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Approximate simultaneous prediction interval for k future observations
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Prediction interval for the mean of k future observations
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Approximate statistical tolerance interval that contains at least proportion p  of the population
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Confidence interval for the population mean
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip5: Prediction interval for the standard deviation of k future observations
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip6: Confidence interval for the population standard deviation

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata: Suppresses the tables produced by default.

[Syntax: OUTINTERVALS=SAS-data-set] 
          
Specifies an output SAS data set containing the intervals and related information.

[Syntax: P=value-list] 
          
Lists values of p for the tolerance intervals. These values must be between 0.00001 to 0.99999.

Determines whether the intervals computed are one-sided lower, one-sided upper, 
or two-sided intervals, respectively.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Intervals computed are one-sided lower.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Intervals computed are one-sided upper.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: BY variables; 
      
The BY statement specifies variables in the input data set that are used for BY 
processing. A separate chart is created for each set of observations defined by 
the levels of the BY variables. The input data set must be sorted in order of the 
BY variables.

Syntax: FREQ variable; 
      
The FREQ statement names a variable that provides frequencies for each observation 
in the input data set. If n is the value of the FREQ variable for a given observation, 
then that observation is used n times. If the value of the FREQ variable is missing 
or is less than one, the observation is not used in the analysis. If the value is not 
an integer, only the integer portion is used.
